The economy techs allow you to make the most out of the planet you are on by:[br/][bulletList][bullet]Unlocking new [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000002A7]Sector Specialization[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Upgrading the effectiveness of [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Providing passive bonuses for [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] moving on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

Elites are advanced [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink], the behemoths of [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink]. Their focus can range from support, offense or battlefield control [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink], often mixing roles.[br/]A [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] needs to have an [hyperlink,000003B50000081C]Elite Military[/hyperlink] structure in order to produce these units.[br/][hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Races[/hyperlink] do not start with any of these units unlocked, but they can be researched via the [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research Tree[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]These units are usually [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier III and Tier IV[/hyperlink].

An [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] with any [hyperlink,0000034500000168]Land Moving[/hyperlink] units requires the [hyperlink,000003BD000011D2]Aquatic Deployment Tech[/hyperlink] to enter water hexes. This tech is found in [hyperlink,000003AC00000268]Economy Research[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Once this [hyperlink,000003AC00000323]Tech[/hyperlink] is unlocked, units need to have at least 12 [movewalk/] Move Points to embark into water, and expends all of its move points to do so.[br/]When disembarking from water to land, the move point cost is 6 plus the cost of the [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink] that unit is moving onto.[br/][br/]While embarked, units will sometimes lose access to certain [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink], normally those that require ground to use. They will also suffer a damage weakness to all [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channels[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The embarking and disembarking costs (as well as some of the embarked penalties) can be improved or mitigated via the Economy tech group.

Empire tasks are goals for a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] to achieve, guiding them during their conquest of the planet. Completing an empire task always gives a [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrine[/hyperlink] as a reward, but can also give an extra pioneer reward for the first player to complete it.[br/][br/]Empire tasks are closely tied to the three capability categories: [hyperlink,000003AC00000271]Unity[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC00000272]Military[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000273]Development[/hyperlink].

It is important to keep your empire well developed. Empire Upgrades are specific global bonuses that apply to everything you control and help you grow and expand. These bonuses can, for example, give your colonies extra [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resources[/hyperlink] income or allow [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] to [hyperlink,000003AC000000B6]Embark[/hyperlink] and move over water. In addition, empire upgrades can provide you with extra bonuses concerning operations such as:[br/][bulletList][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000E1]Operational Strength[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000E2]Operational Defense[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Tactical Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000002B]Strategic Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039F000024DA]Doctrine Slots[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

Energy is a global resource that is used for constructing [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structures[/hyperlink], unit [hyperlink,000003AC000000D4]Upkeep[/hyperlink], launching [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Modding[/hyperlink] units.[br/][br/]Each [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink]’s energy income is added to the global energy reserve, and all energy spent is withdrawn from this pool. Colonies can increase their energy income by building energy [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in their [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] and assigning [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] to energy [hyperlink,000003AC000002B6]Colonist Slots[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Energy can be traded through [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomacy[/hyperlink].

When a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009C]Weapon[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000002B1]Vehicle[/hyperlink] is unlocked by [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researching[/hyperlink] a unit in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research Tree[/hyperlink], this standard-issue equipment can be purchased by all [hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink] under your control by going to the Hero Panel interface and selecting the [hyperlink,000003AC0000009C]Weapon[/hyperlink] or Module Slot. These will often cost [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink][energy/] and [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink][tricorium/].

The event list contains all [hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Events[/hyperlink] that have happened since the previous [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turn[/hyperlink] and during the current turn. It is located above the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E0]Minimap[/hyperlink] on the right side of the screen while on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Selecting an event from the list will show the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] relevant information of the event by:[br/][bulletList][bullet]Centering the camera on the location where the event took place.[/bullet][bullet]Showing the relevant information interface, such as the [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomacy[/hyperlink] interface.[/bullet][bullet]Opening a pop-up window.[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Events can also be dismissed, directly removing them from the event list.

The event history is a list of all the important [hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Events[/hyperlink] that have transpired so far throughout the game. It is a useful tool for accessing previously handled events, if needed. It can be accessed using the button underneath the ‘End Turn’ button, to the right of the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E0]Minimap[/hyperlink].

The Events system helps you manage your empire by bringing new developments to your attention. Some events are merely notifications, while others require you to act. All events that have happened since the previous [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turn[/hyperlink] and during the current turn are shown in the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B7]Event List[/hyperlink] at the right side of the screen above the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E0]Minimap[/hyperlink] while on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Events include: [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]Quests[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomacy[/hyperlink], hostile [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink] and more.[br/][br/]The [hyperlink,000003AC000000B9]Task Notifier[/hyperlink] is located underneath the event list and informs the player of possible actions they can do during their current turn as well as urgent matters that require their attention.

A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] gains experience whenever they are victorious in battle. Experience is calculated based on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] and number of the units defeated, divided by the number of units on the victor’s side when the battle began.[br/]When a normal unit accumulates enough experience, their [hyperlink,000003AC000000A2]Unit Rank[/hyperlink] will increase, granting incremental bonuses. When [hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink] accumulate enough experience, they gain skill points to invest into [hyperlink,000003AC0000009F]Hero Upgrades[/hyperlink].

Explosives are always a right answer to any argument, if they don’t want to listen then blowing them away is a viable solution. The Explosive Weapons Group uses the Kinetic [DamagePhysical/] [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink]. Explosive Weapon abilities include high damage, Stagger, and Blinding.[br/][br/]Ethereal units are resistant to the Kinetic damage channel.

Fabricated Casus Belli are unique [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] in that they do not require any provocative action from the target player to be generated and are essentially false reasons for declaring wars. These are gained from using certain [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]covert operations[/hyperlink] on other players. They can be used in [hyperlink,000003AC00000306]declaring wars[/hyperlink] like normal, but they can not be forgiven through [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Trying to [hyperlink,000003AC000000E7]denounce[/hyperlink] using a Fabricated Casus Belli will give the opposing player a Casus Belli.

A faction banner is used to show which player or faction owns a particular unit or sector on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. There are the following types of banners:[bulletlist][bullet]Player Banner, which have two colors and a personal symbol[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Faction[/hyperlink] Banners, which are grey with a colored NPC faction symbol[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000A3]Marauder Faction[/hyperlink] Banners, which are grey with a red skull symbol[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Race[/hyperlink] Banners, which are grey and show an icon representing a race; often seen at [hyperlink,0000039A000010D7]Settlements[/bullet][/bulletlist]

Each [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Race[/hyperlink] has a favored [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink]. Within their favored clime, the units of that race gain a [hyperlink,000003AC000000C3]Morale[/hyperlink] bonus.[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000018]Assembly[/hyperlink][largetab/]-[largetab/]Arctic[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000016]Amazon[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/]-[largetab/]Arcadian[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000001A]Dvar[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/]-[largetab/]Arid[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000017]Kir'Ko[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/]-[largetab/]Fungal[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000001B]Syndicate[/hyperlink][largetab/]-[largetab/]Arid[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000015]Vanguard[/hyperlink][largetab/]-[largetab/]Arcadian[/bullet][/bulletlist]

If a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] is hit with an attack from its flanks, they will take 20% more damage from the attack. During [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], a unit’s flanks are its 3 rear hex edges.

Sometimes an assault will not go according to plan. If you are the attacker, you can use retreat zones located at the edges of the [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] map to escape. A unit that steps onto the retreat zone’s hex is removed from combat.[br/][br/]You can only use these when in [hyperlink,000003AC000002EE]Manual Combat[/hyperlink], as units in auto combat will not use retreat zones.[br/]Beware: units that flee combat will be left with zero [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink].

Food is a resource that is separate for each colony. It drives [hyperlink,000003AC000002B7]Colonist Growth[/hyperlink] which in turn leads to [hyperlink,000003BD000016D8]Colony Expansion[/hyperlink] and higher economic income. Food is also crucial for [hyperlink,000003AC00000305]Colonist Upkeep[/hyperlink], as insufficient food income can lead to [hyperlink,000003BD000016D9]Starvation[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Colonies can increase their food income by building food [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in their [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] and assigning [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] to food [hyperlink,000003AC000002B6]Colonist Slots[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Food can be shared between colonies using the [hyperlink,000003AC000002AA]Food Sharing[/hyperlink] mechanic.

The Global Pool is the combined [hyperlink,000003AC00000022]Food[/hyperlink] from all of your [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink], remaining food not used for [hyperlink,000003AC00000305]Upkeep[/hyperlink] or colony growth at the end of the turn is lost.

Food Sharing allows players to distribute [hyperlink,000003AC00000022]Food[/hyperlink] between their [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink] to support other colonies with low food income.[br/]This can help new and struggling colonies grow faster, or prevent [hyperlink,000003BD000016D9]Starvation[/hyperlink] at colonies that have focused their colonists on different production slots.[br/][br/]All food Sharing options distribute unused food in a colony after [hyperlink,000003AC00000305]Upkeep[/hyperlink] of their colonists needs.[br/][br/]There are 4 options for Food Sharing in a colony:[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]Prevent Deficit - This is the default option, taking no food from the [hyperlink,000003E90000001D]Global Pool[/hyperlink] unless needed to prevent deficit (Starvation). All unused food is put towards growing the colony and adding a new colonist to the population.[/bullet][br/][br/][bullet]Take - This option allows the colony to take as much food as it can from the [hyperlink,000003E90000001D]Global Pool[/hyperlink]. The colony can never take more food from the pool than is needed for it to gain its next colonist, so the amount taken will change frequently.[/bullet][br/][br/][bullet]Share All and Sell Excess - This option distributes any unused food to the global pool, allowing other colonies to take from it. Food remaining from the global pool at the end of the turn is sold for [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] at a rate of 2 food per energy.[/bullet][br/][br/][bullet]Share Half - This option provides half of the unused food from the colony to the global pool, remaining food is put towards growing the colony and adding a new colonist to the population.[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]When sharing food with other colonies, 40% is lost through Food Sharing Tax. This tax can be reduced with colony upgrades.

A forward base is a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] owned structure that can be built in any [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink] to extend their territory and lay [hyperlink,000003A600000329]Claim[/hyperlink] on adjacent sectors. Forward bases can be built by any [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] in any sector that does not have a [hyperlink,000003AC00000338]Dominant Location[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Forward bases do not collect income from their sector, and have no economic benefit.

It is important to found [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink] to both [hyperlink,000003A600000329]Claim[/hyperlink] and exploit new territories before other players can do so. New colonies provide additional sources of income and extra [hyperlink,000003AC00000295]Production Queues[/hyperlink] for building [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]A colony can be founded by moving a [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF6]Colonizer[/hyperlink] unit to the center of a sector and selecting the ‘Found Colony’ option in the sector panel. [hyperlink,0000039A000010D7]Settlement[/hyperlink] locations can reward the player with either a colony or colonizer as well, directly aiding the extension of your empire.[br/][br/]Colonies can be [hyperlink,000003BD000016D8]Expanded[/hyperlink] to incorporate more [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink].

A [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] can convert its [hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink] income into [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] using the generate energy option listed at the bottom of the various production tabs in the colony interface. This will create additional energy income equal to 25% of the production income.[br/][br/]Generating energy is the same as any other production project, taking up a slot in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000298]Colony Production[/hyperlink], meaning that whilst generating energy, a colony cannot use its production income for any other production project.

A [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] can convert its [hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink] income into [hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink] using the generate knowledge option listed at the bottom of the various production tabs in the colony interface. This will create additional research income equal to 25% of the production income.[br/][br/]Generate knowledge is the same as any other production project, taking up a slot in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000295]Production Queue[/hyperlink], meaning that whilst generating knowledge, a colony cannot use its production income for any other production project.[br/][br/]The generate knowledge option must first be unlocked in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000263]Society Research Tree[/hyperlink], under the economy section.

Grudge is a point value that modifies the [hyperlink,000003AC00000097]opinion[/hyperlink] from one player to another. Grudge is created by having [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] and can only be removed by resolving the Casus Belli and not being at [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]war[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Grudge is increased for each Casus Belli point that a player has on another player. This grudge is directly subtracted from the opinion.[br/][br/]When the players are not at war and the current grudge value is higher than the result of the Casus Belli, the grudge will decay until it reaches the minimal value.

All [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] have a guard ability that they can use to protect themselves during [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink]. Units must spend at least one [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Point[/hyperlink] to activate this ability, and once used, the unit locks in place in a defensive stance.[br/]These abilities vary by unit, but most of them can be interrupted by [hyperlink,000003AC000002DE]Staggering[/hyperlink] the unit.[br/][br/]If a guard ability is selected by mistake, or you wish to reposition a unit after activating its guard mode, selecting the unit and choosing the guard ability will cancel the guarded stance, restoring its action points to the number it had before entering this mode.[br/][br/]If a tactical combat turn passes while a unit still has action points, it automatically activates its guard ability.

Happiness indicates how content the population of a particular colony is with their situation. Positive happiness can trigger economic boosts, whereas negative happiness can cause [hyperlink,000003AC000002B4]Riots[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]You can gain happiness through [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink] which also provides happiness slots which in turn generate more happiness when colonists are assigned to them through [hyperlink,000003AC000002B5]Colonist Management[/hyperlink]. [br/]The happiness income of a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] is added to its happiness pool at the end of each turn. When the happiness pool reaches the [hyperlink,000003AC000002BD]Happiness Events[/hyperlink] threshold, a happiness event occurs.[br/][br/]If happiness income is negative, the amount is subtracted from the happiness pool instead. Once happiness reaches its lower threshold, an [hyperlink,000003AC000002BE]Unhappiness Event[/hyperlink] occurs. Once either a happiness or unhappiness event has occurred, the happiness pool will be reset to 0.[br/][br/]The following Colony Structures provide happiness in your Colony:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,0000034100000AD3]Recreation Dome[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000034100000AD9]Botanical Gardens[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003B5000002FA]Virtual Entertainment Plaza[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

Happiness events occur in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] when its [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]Happiness[/hyperlink] reaches the positive threshold. Happiness events boost the income of a randomly selected resource (energy, food, production or research) by a base value of 300% for a single turn.[br/][br/]The threshold for happiness events to occur becomes higher the more [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] a colony has, meaning that it is more difficult for higher population colonies to trigger happiness events.[br/][br/]# colonists[largetab/][largetab/]Base Threshold (positive / negative)[br/]3[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]30 / -30[br/]10[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]50 / -20[br/]14[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]70 / -10[br/][br/]See also:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002BE]Unhappiness Events[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

A harbor is automatically assigned to the first [hyperlink,000003AC000002E7]Water Province Sector[/hyperlink] that a colony claims. Water [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] built in a colony will appear in the colony’s harbor sector when their construction is complete. [br/][br/]When there are multiple water province sectors, the option to [hyperlink,000003BD000016D3]Relocate the Harbor[/hyperlink] between them becomes available in the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink].

The fall of the Star Union caused a age of strife on its planet’s, with major wars and fighting for territory were commonplace. The after effects of the weapons of mass destruction used during these wars can still be found on the planet’s surface today, by the hazards left on its surface.[br/][br/]Hazards are [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. They have a sector-wide effect on [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] in their [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink], both on the strategic map and in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Hazards apply a severe economic penalty to any [hyperlink,000003BD000016D5]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] in which they are located. They can be removed using an [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operation[/hyperlink] that is unlocked via [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink].

Your Headquarters building provides you with basic income, and acts as the respawn point for your [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commander[/hyperlink] to [hyperlink,000003AC00000301]recuperate[/hyperlink] when they have fallen.[br/][br/]A player can only ever have one HQ building in a game. The HQ building can be transferred to another [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] under the player’s control by using the [hyperlink,000003BD000016D2]Transfer HQ[/hyperlink] operation in the target colony. Losing the HQ while the commander is recuperating will result in [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]defeat[/hyperlink].

[hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink] can equip special items and mods unique to heroes only. Most of these are gained when you unlock units in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research Tree[/hyperlink] or find them as [hyperlink,000003AC000002EC]Loot[/hyperlink] when clearing [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. These often take the form of Primary or Secondary [hyperlink,000003AC0000009C]Weapons[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC000002B1]Vehicles[/hyperlink] and rarely [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Mods[/hyperlink].

When a [hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Hero[/hyperlink] gains enough experience to [hyperlink,000003AC00000328]Level Up[/hyperlink], they gain 5 skill points to use on hero upgrades. These points can be used by entering the hero’s unit panel and accessing the hero upgrades interface. Skill points do not have to be used immediately, and can be saved to be used later.[br/][br/]Hero upgrades come from a general upgrade pool, but there are some upgrades that are only available to heroes with a certain [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Race[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC00000329]Secret Technology[/hyperlink]. Some upgrades require a certain hero level before they can be acquired, while others need a prerequisite to be unlocked.

Heroes, like your [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commander[/hyperlink], are talented individuals with the possibility to specialize and buff your armies. Their great number of available [hyperlink,000003AC0000009F]Hero Upgrades[/hyperlink] they have to choose from when they [hyperlink,000003AC00000328]Level Up[/hyperlink] makes them a very important type of [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink].[br/]These are also the only units that can equip [hyperlink,000003AC0000031C]Hero Equipment[/hyperlink], which includes different [hyperlink,000003AC0000009C]Weapons[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000002B1]Vehicles[/hyperlink] that can completely change their [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink]and which [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Mods[/hyperlink] these units can use.[br/]These are kept in the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E9]Arsenal[/hyperlink], and if a Hero owns a particular piece of equipment they no longer need, they can sell it.[br/][br/]New heroes will come to you as the game progresses and will offer their service for a small [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink][energy/] payment. Unlike normal units, they don’t have an [hyperlink,000003AC000000D4]Upkeep[/hyperlink] cost.

In [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] and on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink], the world is divided into a grid of six-sided shapes called hexes. On the world map, a hex can contain an [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink], a [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Location[/hyperlink], or both. In tactical combat a hex can contain a single [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC00000320]Obstacle[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]If there is more than one entity on a hex a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] can cycle through them by selecting the hex multiple times.

Hit Points represent the amount of damage a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] can take before they are destroyed. If a unit’s hit points drop to zero, that unit is defeated. Units [hyperlink,000003AC0000030F]Regenerate[/hyperlink] a certain number of hit points each turn on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]A unit’s maximum number of hit points can be increased by equipping it with certain [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink].

The production of a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structure[/hyperlink] in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] can be instantly completed by spending [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink]. To do so, the ‘Buy Now’ button can be used, which is located to the left of the current production project. The energy cost of hurrying production depends on the remaining [hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink] still needed for completion of the production project.

The north and south poles of any planet contain impassable terrain. [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] cannot move onto any [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink] with impassable terrain.[br/][br/]Impassable terrain is represented by ice floes at the top and bottom of any map. In some worlds there is also impassable terrain represented by Void.

Imperial Defenses are [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] found in some [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink]. They have a sector-wide effect on any [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] in the sector, as well as any unit engaged in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] within the sector.[br/][br/]These can be claimed by defeating the [hyperlink,000003CF0000009F]Marauder Guards[/hyperlink] present, or from an enemy faction controlling it.[br/][br/] Once claimed and the sector is owned, an Imperial Defense [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operation[/hyperlink] becomes available to the commander that owns it. This operation can only be cast on the commander's own colonies.[br/][br/]If ownership of the Imperial Defense structure is lost, any priming or active operations granted by this structure will removed.[br/][br/]The structure may be Razed, rendering it unusable until rebuilt. The Structure can be rebuilt by having a unit on the ruins.

When a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]commander[/hyperlink] is recuperating, it means they have been defeated on the battlefield and need to spend time recovering inside the recuperation pod in your [hyperlink,000003AC000000E3]Headquarters[/hyperlink]. After 3 turns, a commander will return from the recuperation pod and will respawn back at their headquarters. While recuperating, the number of diplomatic actions that can be performed is limited. [br/][br/]If the commander is recuperating while their headquarters is taken, they suffer [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]defeat[/hyperlink].
Independents is a collective name for all non-[hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Player Race[/hyperlink] units in the world.

Influence is the currency used for performing diplomatic actions involving other players, NPC factions and settlements. It is gained by completing [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]NPC faction quests[/hyperlink] and through building certain colony structures.[br/][br/]Influence is used in the following actions:[bulletlist][bullet]Making [hyperlink,000003AC00000274]Pronouncements[/hyperlink] about other players[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Trading[/hyperlink] with NPC faction dwellings[/bullet][bullet]Convincing an NPC faction to [hyperlink,000003AC00000339]leave their position[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Peacefully resolving an encounter with a [hyperlink,0000039A000010D7]settlement[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Priming certain [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]covert operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

When [hyperlink,000003AC0000028E]Moving an Army[/hyperlink] onto a [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink] occupied by an enemy army controlled by a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Faction[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000000A3]Marauder[/hyperlink], the combat interface will be shown. From here, the attacker will see the relative strength of the two armies, represented by the system estimating who is stronger. The attacker may choose between [hyperlink,000003AC000002EE]Manual and Auto Combat[/hyperlink], or abort the attack if they feel like the enemy is too strong. Note that the estimation doesn’t guarantee victory or defeat, as the system doesn’t look at unit weaknesses or abilities, just overall relative strength.[br/]If manual combat is selected, the army will enter [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] against the enemy. If there are allies or enemies of the attacker surrounding the hex where combat will be initiated, the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B1]Adjacent Hex Rule[/hyperlink] enters into effect.[br/][br/]Once the attacker selects its attacking method, the defender will choose between manual and auto combat.

The Arsenal is a global space where your commander & heroes can equip and swap [hyperlink,000003AC0000031C]Hero Equipment[/hyperlink]. [hyperlink,000003AC000002EC]Loot[/hyperlink] picked up in the strategic map will automatically be transported to the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E9]Arsenal[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Unwanted equipment in your arsenal may be sold for 70% of item [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] cost. [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] is not refunded.

The most conventional way of fighting wars for centuries still proves to be an effective way of doing so by making your enemies bleed before they can do it to you. The Firearms Weapons Group uses the Kinetic [DamagePhysical/] [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink]. Firearms Weapon abilities include high-damage low-accuracy shots and cause bleeding.[br/][br/]Ethereal units are resistant to the Kinetic damage channel.

Knowledge is the global resource used for [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researching[/hyperlink] the lost [hyperlink,000003AC00000323]Techs[/hyperlink] of the fallen empire.[br/][br/]You can accumulate more knowledge through the following actions:[br/][bulletList][bullet]Annexing Landmarks that provide knowledge[/bullet][bullet]Annexing Resource Nodes that provide knowledge[/bullet][bullet]Producing [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] that grant knowledge bonuses[/bullet][bullet]Producing [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Assigning Colonists to Slots that generate knowledge[/bullet][bullet]The use of [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Specific [hyperlink,000003AC000000E1]Operational Strength[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

When a [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmark[/hyperlink] is [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] for a colony, the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink] unlocks the ability to build a unique [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structure[/hyperlink] depending on the annexed landmark. These unique structures provide the colony with military bonuses for units built in that colony.[br/][br/]Structures unlocked from Golden Landmarks:[line/][br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000359]Cryo-Medical Facility[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] ([hyperlink,0000034100000B48]Cryo Facility[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000365]Relaxation Centers[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,00000395000001F0]Elysium Parks[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000035D]Imperial Training Center[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,00000395000001DA]Government Palace[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000369]Starship Maintenance Bay[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000038700002E72]Spaceport[/hyperlink])[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Structures unlocked from Silver Landmarks:[line/][br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000330]Starlight Observatory[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,000003950000030C]Celestian Archives[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000032B]Heavy Duty Manufacturing Plant[/hyperlink][largetab/] ([hyperlink,00000395000002EA]Promethean Vault[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD0000033A]Shrine of Darkness[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,00000395000002EB]Psynumbra Sanctorum[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000326]Weapons Facility[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000039500000303]Synthesis Network[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000304]Rift Generator[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] ([hyperlink,000003950000030D]Voidtech Complex[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00000335]Genetics Lab[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000039500000306]Xenoplague Labs[/hyperlink])[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Structures unlocked from Bronze Landmarks:[line/][br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD000004AC]Shielding Laboratory[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000034100000AC1]Imperial Energy Complex[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD000004AD]Learning Center[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000034100000ACB]Imperial Research Center[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD000004B2]Nutrition Center[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000034100000ACD]Imperial Biodome Compound[/hyperlink])[/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD000004B7]Reinforcement Factory[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,0000034100000AC6]Imperial Mining Facility[/hyperlink])[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00001921]Aquatic Training Facility[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,000003C900000016]Imperial Sunken City[/hyperlink])[/bullet][/bulletlist]

Landmarks are remnants of important Star Union structures that still provide major advantages to players who manage to [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annex[/hyperlink] them to their [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink]. Landmarks include large industrial complexes, ancient temples and secret research facilities.[br/][br/]Landmarks are rare [hyperlink,000003AC00000338]Dominant Locations[/hyperlink] found on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. They can offer great economic and military value when [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] to a [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Landmarks come in three variations:[br/][bulletlist][bullet]Bronze Landmarks: provide minor economic benefits and are quite common[/bullet][bullet]Silver Landmarks: provide subtantial economic benefits and are more rare[/bullet][bullet]Gold Landmarks: provide greater economic benefits and are very rare[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Landmarks are bases that have a predetermined exploitation for one of the four main [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resources[/hyperlink]. Gold and Silver Landmarks automatically have the highest [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Level[/hyperlink] in their [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink], while Bronze landmarks need to be levelled up just like regular sectors.[br/][br/]When a landmark is annexed, it will unlock special doctrines that the player can use for as long as the landmark is under their control.[br/][br/]Before Gold and Silver Landmarks can be annexed, their guards need to be removed. Clearing out Landmarks is made even more perilous because only a single [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] can enter a structure to defeat the army lurking within.

Laser Weapons are great for setting things on fire and melting through armor and shields. The Laser Weapons Group uses the Thermal [DamageThermal/] [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink]. Laser Weapon abilities include Shield Breaking, Blinding, and Burning targets.[br/][br/]Ethereal and Mineral units are resistant to Thermal damage; Plant units are weak to it.

The conquest victory is a military victory which is achieved when a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] successfully [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]Defeats[/hyperlink] all other players by killing their [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commanders[/hyperlink] and capturing their [hyperlink,000003AC000000E3]Headquarters[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The conquest victory is closely tied to an empire’s [hyperlink,000003AC00000272]Military Capability[/hyperlink].

When a [hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Hero[/hyperlink] gains enough [hyperlink,000003AC000000A1]Experience[/hyperlink], they will level up, gaining 5 skill points that can be spent on [hyperlink,000003AC0000009F]Hero Upgrades[/hyperlink].

A planet contains a large variety of different locations, ranging from remains of the Star Union to natural phenomena. [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] can contain multiple locations, potentially defended by an [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Faction[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000000A3]Marauder[/hyperlink] army. Locations are always visible on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] and occupy a single [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Some locations can give an economic benefit to a colony if the sector they are in is [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink]. If an [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] is stood upon a location within another player’s [hyperlink,000003AC000002E4]Domain[/hyperlink], the location is considered [hyperlink,000003AC000002EF]Occupied[/hyperlink] and will not yield any economic benefit.[br/][br/]Locations can have a sector-wide effect that will affect all armies within that sector. This effect can be either positive or negative.[br/][br/]If the location is on the sector banner in the center of the sector, then this location is a [hyperlink,000003AC00000338]Dominant Location[/hyperlink].

Loot rewards you with unique [hyperlink,000003AC0000031C]Hero Equipment[/hyperlink] and can be found by clearing [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] and completing [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]Quests[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. This equipment is found on the hex where the combat took place or the quest was completed. It can then be acquired by an[hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] and transported to the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E9]Arsenal[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Loot can alternatively be sold for a moderate amount of [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink][energy/].

When [hyperlink,000003AC000000C0]Initiating Combat[/hyperlink], you will be able to choose between Manual and Auto Combat.[br/][br/]Manual combat takes you to [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], allowing you direct control over owned units. Here you have control of their use of [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Points[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink], and also where they position themselves on the battlefield. This option is excellent if you want more control over your units in order to minimize losses, or for tough battles where precise decisions are important to assure victory.[br/][br/]Auto combat makes your units fight on their own, and resolves combat instantly. This option is better suited for battles where victory is certain.[br/][br/]In both cases, after combat is resolved, an interface will show the results of the battle and there will be the option to rewatch the battle by pressing the replay button.[br/][br/]Note that, in some multiplayer modes, only auto combat is allowed.

Marauder factions are planet-roamers who hold no allegiance to anyone but themselves. They come in various shapes and forms from wildlife to pirates, but one thing is true: no amount of diplomacy will help here.[br/]Beware, some of these savages may attack you in search of resources.

Martial law can be used to deal with [hyperlink,000003AC000002B4]Rioters[/hyperlink] in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink]. Instituting martial law will bring rioters in line to convert them back into regular [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] at a rate of 1 rioter every 3 turns. However, there is a 25% chance that the rioter is killed, instead of converted back into a regular colonist. [br/][br/]While martial law is active, the colony neither gains nor loses happiness, and it generates 20% less income.

In [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], melee units are always on overwatch. They attack any adjacent unit that uses an ability or that moves away from the melee unit. Like normal [hyperlink,000003AC000000C8]Overwatch[/hyperlink], staggering a unit that is in melee overwatch will cause it to lose the overwatch state.

Migrate Colony replaces the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink]’s current [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Race[/hyperlink] with another race present in the player’s empire. The ‘Migrate’ action is available for each colony that the player owns, as well as any colony that the player is currently [hyperlink,000003AC000002EF]Occupying[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Migrating a colony is quicker than [hyperlink,000003BD000016CD]Absorbing[/hyperlink] it, but will incur severe [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]Reputation[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000286]Race Relation[/hyperlink] penalties, and a third of the [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonist[/hyperlink] population will be lost as well. These penalties can be worthwhile, however, both for the takeover speed and in order to exchange a race with whom you have bad relations with a race with whom you have good relations.. Migrating takes 3 turns and can be aborted at any time prior to completion.

A [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player’s[/hyperlink] military capability represents their army strength and overall military power as well as offensive [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operation[/hyperlink] capacity. Players are compared to each other regarding these various aspects and are [hyperlink,000003AC000002B0]Ranked[/hyperlink] accordingly. Their ranking can change at any point during a [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turn[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The military capability is tied closely with the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026E]Conquest Victory[/hyperlink] condition and [hyperlink,000003A70000000B]Domination Victory[/hyperlink] condition.[br/][br/]The ability to view capabilities is unlocked through the [hyperlink,000003BD000004BE]Area Surveillance[/hyperlink] research skill.

The Military Research Tree is your main source of army advancement, allowing you to acquire new [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink] and your [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF8]Doomsday Weapon[/hyperlink]. It consists of one [hyperlink,000003AC00000264]Racial Tech Group[/hyperlink], two [hyperlink,000003AC00000265]Weapon Tech Groups[/hyperlink], and one [hyperlink,000003AC00000266]Secret Tech Group[/hyperlink]. Most of the unlocks in the Military Research Tree influence your effectiveness in combat. However, depending on what race and secret tech have been chosen, you will also have several options for the Strategic Map as well.

Certain [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] have [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] that attempt to mind control other units. If this is successful, the unit comes under the control of the enemy, and will disappear after combat.[br/][br/]Mind control can be dispelled, and in most cases, if the source is a unit, killing the caster will free the mind-controlled unit back to its original player’s ownership.

The minimap shows an overview of the planet based on the [hyperlink,000003AC000002FA]Vision[/hyperlink] that the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] has at that time. It is located in the bottom right of the screen while on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]In addition to the colors for land and water, the minimap shows:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002E4]Player Domain[/hyperlink] shaded with their player color[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwellings[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002B9]Uninhabitable[/hyperlink] mountain sectors[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]The minimap starts small, but as the player explores more of the strategic map, it will zoom out to always contain the entire explored area. [hyperlink,000003AC000002FF]Unexplored Hexes[/hyperlink] are covered by a thick layer of cloud.

When an attack has low [hyperlink,000003AC0000030C]Accuracy[/hyperlink] against a target, there is a high chance it will either miss or graze.[br/][br/]When the attack misses it will either hit an unintended friendly or enemy target in the path of the attack or miss completely. Some attacks, especially [hyperlink,000003AC00000294]Area of Effect[/hyperlink], will move one or two hexes away from the intended target when they miss.[br/][br/]A grazing attack still hits the intended target, but deals 50% less damage to it.

Morale represents a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit’s[/hyperlink] general motivation, affecting its chance to [hyperlink,000003AC000002DC]Critically Hit or Fumble[/hyperlink] an attack. A unit’s current morale level can be found on the top right corner of its unit panel.[br/]The higher the morale level, the higher the chance for it to critically hit an enemy. The lower it gets, the higher the chance for the unit to fumble its attack. A unit might even [hyperlink,000003AC000002DF]Desert[/hyperlink] the army if its morale level is too low.[br/][br/]The following table shows the chance of a unit to critically hit or fumbling an attack based on their Morale.[br/][br/] Unit Morale[tab/][largetab/][largetab/] Critical/Fumble Chance[line/][br/][tab/] 200[happiness/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]{lowCritical}% Critical Chance[br/][tab/] 400[happiness/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]{mediumCritical}% Critical Chance[br/][tab/] 600[happiness/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]{highCritical}% Critical Chance[br/][br/][tab/]-200[anger/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]{lowFumble}% Fumble Chance[br/][tab/]-400[anger/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]{mediumFumble}% Fumble Chance[br/][tab/]-600[anger/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]{highFumble}% Fumble Chance[br/][br/]

Move Points determine the distance a unit can move on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] and in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink]. When an [hyperlink,000003AC0000028E]Army Moves[/hyperlink], each individual unit loses move points depending on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hexes[/hyperlink] they move onto. The move points cost to move onto a hex depends on the hex’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink].[br/]A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] may have a [hyperlink,000003AC000000C6]Passive Ability[/hyperlink] or movement type that allows it to spend fewer move points than other units when moving in certain terrains or climes.[br/][br/]When moving an army, or while hovering over a hex, the move points [movewalk/] presented on the tooltip is the cost for a regular [hyperlink,0000034500000168]Land Moving[/hyperlink] unit to move onto that hex.

An [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] can be moved by selecting it and then selecting the Hex you want the army to move onto. If all of the [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] in the army have enough [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink] to move to the desired hex, there will be a blue pathway, meaning the army can make its way there on this strategic [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turn[/hyperlink].[br/]If there is a red pathway, it means that the army does not have enough move points to move there this turn, but if that pathway is selected, the army will enter an [hyperlink,000003AC000002E1]Automatic Movement[/hyperlink] mode.[br/][br/]An army can only go as far as the slowest unit in that army, but units with any remaining move points can be [hyperlink,000003AC000002F9]Split[/hyperlink] from the army to move further if necessary.[br/][br/]A [hyperlink,0000034500000168]Land Moving[/hyperlink] army can only go into water through [hyperlink,000003AC000000B6]Embarking[/hyperlink].

Using the Negotiation option in the Diplomacy interface, you can form and break treaties, and trade with others. A proposal is formed by adding items to the trade and then sending it to another player. The other player then can accept, decline or send a counter offer. [br/][br/]Accepting or declining the proposal will complete or cancel the trade and affect opinions based on the answer. A counter offer will send the proposal back to the other player. Using the “Balance trade offer” option, the proposal can be automatically balanced for both parties. When gifting items, the receiving player’s opinion towards the sending player raises depending on the value of the gift.[br/][br/]Negotiating has the following options:[bulletlist][bullet]Changing diplomatic state: both parties need to agree to improving the [hyperlink,000003AC0000003A]Diplomatic State[/hyperlink], but decreasing the diplomatic state is one sided and does not require consent from the other player.[/bullet][bullet]Forging or breaking diplomatic treaties: [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]Diplomatic Treaties[/hyperlink] can be created and broken, following the same negotiation logic as diplomatic states.[/bullet][bullet]Overcoming Dislikes: [hyperlink,000003DD00000020]Dislikes[/hyperlink] can be traded away as a single use item, removing all negative opinions associated with them. [/bullet] [bullet]Forgiving [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink]: Casus Belli can be traded away as a single proposal item, which removes all forgivable Casus Belli from a player. Note: some Casus Belli cannot be used in proposals.[/bullet][bullet]Exchanging [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink]: Energy or Cosmite can be directly exchanged or set up as a treaty where one or both players pay resources on every turn.[/bullet][bullet]Trading Province Sectors: Trading a [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink] instantly transfers its ownership and moves any stacks standing on the sector center away from it. Trading [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink] will transfer both the colony core as well as any province sectors.[/bullet][/bulletlist]

[hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC factions[/hyperlink] will send resource demands to a friendly player at regular intervals or when they ignored one of their [hyperlink,000003A600000329]sector claims[/hyperlink]. Declining demands has consequences on relations with a faction, whehereas accepting them maintains relations. [br/][br/]Declining a demand will reset the [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]NPC favor[/hyperlink] with the NPC Faction back to 0. If the relation value is already at 0, your relationship will go down one level (a Neutral state will become War, for example). Accepting a demand will maintain the current relationship level with the NPC faction. [br/][br/]Some demands will require the player to pay certain payment conditions. These conditions can include having to pay economic resources, but also having to transfer ownership of [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]province sectors[/hyperlink] to the faction. The value of the conditions depends on how well the player is progressing and the number of turns they have been on the planet. [br/][br/]Certain demands can be fulfilled through Quests, completing these will maintain your current favor while failing them will lower it. Demands that will lower your relationship level can only be accepted or declined, the NPC factions won't offer quests in these cases.

[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000010]Laser[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039E0000000F]Kinetic[/hyperlink] Damage Types[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003840000028B]Form connections[/hyperlink] to buff individual units.[/bullet][bullet]Seek to build a large peer to peer network of autonomous entities[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]ORIGIN: The robots providing emergency services within the Empire were run by the Conscientious Omnipresent Regency Engine (CORE), but when it faltered during the Collapse they relied on internal backup processors. In the centuries since then, these robots have linked up and developed into a new collective of sentient beings. They called themselves the Autonom.

A [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwelling[/hyperlink] can own a number of smaller outposts called NPC faction bases. These cannot be interacted with like regular dwellings, but still have all the interaction options of an NPC [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] of that [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]Faction[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]NPC faction bases are [hyperlink,000003AC00000338]Dominant Locations[/hyperlink] that act like [hyperlink,0000039A00000928]Spawners[/hyperlink] for their faction, and will spawn armies to attack players with whom the faction is at [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]War[/hyperlink].

[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000000E]Bio[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039E0000000F]Kinetic[/hyperlink] Damage Types[/bullet][bullet]Seeks to gather nutrients and launch a seed pod into space[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]ORIGIN: After being discovered on a distant world, the Growth was cultivated for its stimulating nectar by pharmaceutical companies. Unable to synthesize the drug, biodomes were built to produce nectar in large quantiles. After the Collapse, the Growth broke free overgrowing entire sectors for its goal to expand its biodiversity and spread to new worlds.

[bulletlist][bullet]Decaying Cyborgs[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000000D]Arc[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039E0000000F]Kinetic[/hyperlink] Damage Types[/bullet][bullet]Seek to regain the privileges of their old lives[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Paragon once were the elite citizens of the Star Union. After the Collapse, all interstellar trade and communications ended, leaving the surviving citizens marooned on their worlds. The upper-class Paragons, named after the company that provided their cybernetics, fell from boundless hedonism to a state of survival. As they were no longer able to connect with CORE, their disconnected augmentations that gave them eternal youth and super human abilities began to slowly falter. Many Paragon descended into madness and decay.

[bulletlist][bullet] [hyperlink,0000039E00000011]Psionic[/hyperlink] Damage Types[/bullet][bullet] Bonds with creatures to make them vulnerable for attack[/bullet][bullet] Seek to grow the Psi-Fish Shoal by capturing and feeding on other creatures[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]ORIGIN: It is believed that the Psi-Fish originate from the Void, the space between the planes of existence. Their primary goal is the creation of more Psi-Fish. After the Collapse they preyed on the vulnerable survivors of Star Union, wiping out entire settlements to grow their Shoal—the Psi-Fish race as a whole. They are curious creatures and seekers of knowledge, for as alien as they are to mankind, this universe is entirely alien to them as well.

You have relations with the [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC factions[/hyperlink] you have met on the planet. Improving these relations will allow you to take advantage of [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling Trades[/hyperlink] and other benefits, whereas angering NPC factions will cause them to become hostile. By living at peace with NPC factions and integrating them, you work towards a unified planet, which is part of achieving the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026D]Unifier Victory[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]To meet an NPC faction, an army has to either move near them to talk or the player has to be contacted by them after encountering one of the NPC faction's armies. If met with a positive response, the [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]relation state[/hyperlink] with the NPC faction will become Neutral. [br/][br/]Completing [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]quests[/hyperlink] will increase the [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]favor[/hyperlink] with that faction and when a certain amount of favor is obtained the relation state increases. Increasing the relation state allows the player to unlock a variety of benefits depending on the state, like having access to more Dwelling Trades.[br/][br/]Players can also choose to go to [hyperlink,000003AC00000284]war[/hyperlink] with an NPC faction to take their dwellings by force. While at war, the player cannot perform any quests or access the Dwelling Trades. Only a [hyperlink,000003AC00000308]peace deal[/hyperlink] can revert the relation state back to Neutral.

[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000011]Psionic[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039E0000000E]Biochemical[/hyperlink], and [hyperlink,0000039E0000000F]Kinetic[/hyperlink] Damage Types[/bullet][bullet]Former citizens of the Star Union[/bullet][bullet]Dangerous and unpredictable[/bullet][bullet]Suffer from various psychological disorders[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]ORIGIN: After the Collapse brought the population violently back to reality, they were left to survive in a devastated and lawless universe. The strongest, craziest and most ruthless survivors formed tribal gangs. They fill their days with raiding, cannibalism, debauchery and perverse rituals as a poor replacement for the state of bliss the Union once provided.

The ruins of the Star Union are home to NPC Factions (non-primary combatant factions), disorganized groups of survivors who can be a boon or a curse, depending on whether you befriend them or antagonise them. Beware of making too many enemies, as they can be quite aggressive towards their foes. Their [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwellings[/hyperlink] can be contacted in order to receive [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]Quests[/hyperlink], which can be completed to improve [hyperlink,000003AC00000030]Relations[/hyperlink] with the faction. In time, a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] can gain access to the NPC faction’s [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink], their special [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] and even their dwellings.[br/][br/]NPC Factions:[br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000080]Autonom[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,0000039E0000007F]Growth[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000081]Paragon[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000083]Psi-Fish[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,000003AC000000A4]Spacers[/hyperlink]

NPC favor is a point value that represents the kindness you have expressed towards a [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC faction[/hyperlink]. Reaching a certain amount of favor, improves [hyperlink,000003AC00000030]NPC relations[/hyperlink], which unlocks benefits like Dwelling Trades. Completing quests for the NPC faction or trading with them will increase the collected favor, while declining demands decreases it. [br/][br/]The NPC favor has to be maintained. After meeting a NPC faction, the favor is set to 0. For every completed [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]quest[/hyperlink], the player receives favor, even if they sell the rest of the reward. When the favor reaches a certain amount, the [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]NPC relation state[/hyperlink] increases and the favor is reset to 0. Repeat the process to keep getting better relations.[br/][br/]Overtime the NPC faction will send [hyperlink,000003AC00000276]demands[/hyperlink]. Declining these demands will reset the favor to 0, while accepting them will maintain the current value. Declining a demand while the favor is 0, will lower the relation state by a level. Demands can also be replaced with Quests, this allows you to maintain you current favor without having to pay the Energy or Cosmite. The NPC faction will only allow this if your relation state isn't in danger, should a Demand lower you relation state the only options will be to Accept or Decline.

The player can request a [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC faction[/hyperlink] army to leave a [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]location[/hyperlink] in order to get access to it. Doing so costs an amount of [hyperlink,000003AC0000001B]influence[/hyperlink] that depends on the strength of the army and the value of the location they are defending. [br/][br/]The alternative to requesting the location is [hyperlink,000003AC00000284]declaring war[/hyperlink] to the NPC faction and attacking them.

In order for you to call off a [hyperlink,000003AC00000284]war[/hyperlink] with a [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC faction[/hyperlink], you would need to request a peace deal by interacting with a [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwelling[/hyperlink].You will have to accept the peace deal’s conditions for it to go into effect. These conditions can include having to pay [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]economic resources[/hyperlink] or having to transfer ownership of [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]province sectors[/hyperlink] to the faction.[br/][br/]The value of the conditions depends on the atrocities the player committed towards the NPC faction. Killing faction units and declining peace deals will make future peace deals significantly more expensive.

Obstacles are objects that block the path or provide [hyperlink,000003AC000000B3]Cover[/hyperlink] for units in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], be it full cover which blocks line of sight or partial cover which reduces the chance of a unit being hit. They can be destroyed with Active Abilities in order to remove an enemy’s cover. Fortified obstacles can only be destroyed by abilities with Demolisher. There are a few obstacles that cannot be destroyed at all.

When a location is occupied, it provides no income to the sector in which it is located. If a [hyperlink,000003AC00000338]Dominant Location[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003BD000016D6]Province Base[/hyperlink] is occupied, the entire [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink] provides no income to the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] to which it belongs.[br/][br/]A [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] owned [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Location[/hyperlink] or province base is considered occupied when a hostile [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] is stationed on top of it.

Operational Defense is a measure of how well protected you are from [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] belonging to other players. The higher your operational defense, the lower the [hyperlink,000003AC00000312]Operational Effectiveness[/hyperlink] of any operations that target you, your colonies and your armies.[br/][br/]Operational effectiveness is affected by both the target’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000E2]Operational Defense[/hyperlink][operationdefense/] and your own [hyperlink,000003AC000000E1]Operational Strength[/hyperlink][operationstrength/].[br/]Covert ops have a 60% base chance of success. Each Point difference between the attacker’s Operational Strength and the defenders Operational Defense will add or subtract 5%. The maximum success chance is 90%. If the operation has less than 20% success chance it is impossible to launch it.[br/][br/]You can increase your operational defense by:[br/][bulletList][bullet]Unlocking [hyperlink,000003BD000016D4]Empire Upgrades[/hyperlink] in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000269]Operations Tech Group[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Activating [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink]that improve operational defense[/bullet][/bulletList]
The paragraph added is taken directly from OPERATIONAL_EFFECTIVENESS DESCRIPTION

Operational Strength increases the [hyperlink,000003AC00000312]Operational Effectiveness[/hyperlink] of your [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] succeeding. The higher your operational strength, the higher the success chance of your operations.[br/][br/]Operational effectiveness is affected by both the target’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000E2]Operational Defense[/hyperlink][operationdefense/] and your own [hyperlink,000003AC000000E1]Operational Strength[/hyperlink][operationstrength/].[br/]Covert ops have a 60% base chance of success. Each Point difference between the attacker’s Operational Strength and the defenders Operational Defense will add or subtract 5%. The maximum success chance is 90%. If the operation has less than 20% success chance it is impossible to launch it.[br/][br/]You can increase your operational strength by:[br/][bulletList][bullet]Unlocking [hyperlink,000003BD000016D4]Empire Upgrades[/hyperlink] in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000269]Operations Tech Group[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Activating [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink] that improve operational strength[/bullet][/bulletList]
The paragraph added is taken directly from OPERATIONAL_EFFECTIVENESS DESCRIPTION

Operational coverage is the range within which you can launch [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039E00000072]Tactical Operations[/hyperlink]. The coverage is directly linked to [hyperlink,000003AC000002FA]Vision[/hyperlink], so whatever you can see, you can target with an operation. This means that you will always be able to use operations in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] unless a [hyperlink,000003AC00000314]Combat Effect[/hyperlink] states otherwise.

Operational effectiveness is the overall chance that your [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink] have of succeeding. Both [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] use this value in order to show you the chance of success when you are casting the operation.[br/][br/]Operational effectiveness is affected by both the target’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000E2]Operational Defense[/hyperlink][operationdefense/] and your own [hyperlink,000003AC000000E1]Operational Strength[/hyperlink][operationstrength/].[br/]Covert ops have a 60% base chance of success. Each Point difference between the attacker’s Operational Strength and the defenders Operational Defense will add or subtract 5%. The maximum success chance is 90%. If the operation has less than 20% success chance it is impossible to launch it.[br/][br/]Your Operational Strength and Defense can be upgraded globally by researching [hyperlink,000003BD000016D4]Empire Upgrades[/hyperlink], and enacting Doctrines. Operational Defense can also be buffed through local, per colony effects to protect you from destructive enemy attacks.[br/][br/]Operations that require a success roll generally have a reduced-strength failure effect, so using these ops is never in vain. Note that the outcome of a success roll affects the detection chance of Cover Ops.

Operations are used to support your [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] in the field, to increase the efficiency of your [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink], and to allow you to spy on your enemies. The types of operations available to you are [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] (both of which are only usable on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]), [hyperlink,0000039E00000072]Tactical Operations[/hyperlink] (which can only be used during combat), and [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink] (which globally affect your empire).[br/][br/]Most of these operations are unlocked through research, and are dependent on the Race and Secret Tech you picked. Operations require the expenditure of[hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] and operation points. Some operations also have a chance of success and failure which is based on your overall [hyperlink,000003AC00000312]Operational Effectiveness[/hyperlink].

The operation tech group focuses on providing you with [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] as well as bolstering your offensive operational capabilities against other [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Players[/hyperlink] and defensive capabilities against [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] that target you and providing the player with .[br/][br/]The tech group provides you with operational boosts and unlocks such as:[br/][bulletList][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000002B]Strategic Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Tactical Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039F000024DA]Doctrine Slots[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

Opinion represents how a player empire views another and affects player’s actions towards each other. It is non-mutual and is unique for each relation. Opinion is used by [hyperlink,000003AC00000335]AI controlled[/hyperlink] players to determine the diplomatic actions they should take.[br/][br/]Most diplomatic actions, like [hyperlink,000003AC00000274]pronouncements[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiations[/hyperlink], affect the opinion of the population. Increasing opinion can benefit negotiations while decreasing it could eventually lead to [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]war[/hyperlink].

A [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player’s[/hyperlink] overall capability represents how they measure up against other players on the planet when looking at the three different capability categories. Each capability category represents an aspect of an empire and can lead to its own [hyperlink,000003AC00000324]Victory Condition[/hyperlink].[br/][br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000271]Unity Capability[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000272]Military Capability[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000273]Development Capability[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]The ability to view capabilities is unlocked through the [hyperlink,000003BD000004BE]Area Surveillance[/hyperlink] research skill.

An overlord is the owner of a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EC]vassalage[/hyperlink] and receives a bonus 10% Energy & Knowledge based on each vassals income from the previous turn. The vassal player is forced to help the overlord to reach victory. Overlords can call their vassal into war. The vassal is forced to always accept.[br/][br/]Only the overlord can break the vassalage by declaring war upon the vassal player. If the overlord is defeated, the vassalage is broken and the [hyperlink,000003AC00000341]vassal[/hyperlink] is released.

In [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], when a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] selects the overwatch ability, they will select a zone to overwatch over. On the enemy’s turn, they will automatically attack any enemy unit that moves into this zone with their main offensive [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Ability[/hyperlink]. If the ability is a repeating action, it fires a number of times equal to the action points when the unit entered overwatch.[br/]Staggering a unit that is on overwatch will cause it to lose the overwatch state.[br/][br/]Not all units have access to overwatch, although some can gain access to it with a high [hyperlink,000003AC000000A2]Unit Rank[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]If you selected and set up overwatch by mistake or want to readjust the overwatch location, selecting the unit and choosing the overwatch ability will remove them from overwatch with the amount of [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Points[/hyperlink] they had before entering this mode.

Passive abilities are always enabled on a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink], and many provide bonuses, be it on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] or in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink].[br/]Passives are also used to define the [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF1]Unit Type[/hyperlink] or general information about the unit. In addition, they are prerequisites for applying [hyperlink,000003AC000000CB]Status Effects[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] to a unit.

A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]commander's[/hyperlink] perks determine their personality and background, and give them starting bonuses and penalties. These perks are divided into 4 categories: [bulletlist][bullet]Background, a variety of global bonuses[/bullet][bullet]Commander Loadout, different sets of equipment for the commander[/bullet][bullet]Colony Supplement, improved starting conditions for colony or research[/bullet][bullet]Vices, a variety of penalties with small bonuses[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/]There are limited perk points to spend on perks. Better perks cost more points, and a commander can have only one perk per category.[br/][br/]Vices are unique in that they actually give perk points instead of costing any. These can then be used to get better perks in other categories. Vices give global penalties, so there is a trade-off to be made.

Pickups are one-time collectables which can offer you a variety of rewards. Pickups give an immediate reward, and sometimes trigger special events that lead to further rewards.[br/][br/]Pickups can be found scattered throughout the world. They can be either defended or undefended, with defended pickups yielding greater rewards. Pickups can be collected by any [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] that moves onto the [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink] where it is located. Once a pickup has been collected in this way, it is removed.

Planets, or worlds, are the locations where the gameplay of Age of Wonders: Planetfall takes place. These post-collapse planets were once part of the Star Union, but have since fallen into ruin together with the empire. Now these planets contain many mysteries to be uncovered and countless resources to be taken.[br/][br/]Your mission is to capture the planet through one of the many [hyperlink,000003AC00000324]Victory conditions[/hyperlink], be it through a diplomatic or iron-fisted approach. It’s not an easy task, as others seek to claim the planet for themselves. Through [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Play[/hyperlink] the victor over a planet will emerge![br/][br/]When choosing a scenario, there will be preset randomised worlds. From Capital Worlds to Frontier Worlds, there is a variety of presets to choose from. Alternatively you can use Advanced Setup to find a planet with specific world features, like dominant climes and landmass types.

’Player’ refers to both human players and [hyperlink,000003AC00000335]AI Players[/hyperlink]. Each player controls their own [hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commander[/hyperlink] and empire, with a unique player colour and insignia used for each player’s banners.[br/][br/]Players can interact with each other using [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomacy[/hyperlink], allowing them to trade with, cooperate with and compliment each other, but also to threaten, call for demands and go to war with each other.

After a game is completed, all [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Players[/hyperlink] who participated in the game are ranked according to how high their score is on the final overview screen.[br/][br/]Players who are [hyperlink,000003AC000000B5]Victorious[/hyperlink] are always ranked higher than other players, regardless of their score, and players who [hyperlink,000003AC00000342]Survived[/hyperlink] are always ranked higher than [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]Defeated[/hyperlink] players, regardless of their score.

Popular Support represents how supportive your population is when you lead your empire into war. A popular player pays less [hyperlink,000003AC000000D4]unit upkeep[/hyperlink], has lower production[production/] cost for units and produces more [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]happiness[/hyperlink] in their colonies. The opposite is true for an unpopular player. [br/][br/]Popular Support is affected by starting wars, ending wars and the amount of [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] involved:[bulletlist][bullet]Declaring war without any Casus Belli leads to a large Popular Support penalty while the [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]war[/hyperlink] lasts.[/bullet][bullet]Declaring war with Casus Belli grants Popular Support for a limited time.[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]When a war ends, the Popular Support gained or lost during that war is reset.
A colony’s population consists of the total number of [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink].

[hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] that are marked as a potential colony location can be colonized.
