In order to do so, you must move a [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF6]Colonizer[/hyperlink] unit on top of the sector banner in the middle of a sector and chose the relevant option from the sector information panel. This will build a new [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink], the heart of a colony.[br/][br/]New colonies are best founded near [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Resource Nodes[/hyperlink], so these can be [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] to the colony as it grows. Colonies cannot be built adjacent to already existing colonies.[br/][br/]Sectors that cannot be colonized are marked as [hyperlink,000003AC000002B9]Uninhabitable[/hyperlink].

Production is resource that is separate for each colony. It is used for building [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structures[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink], see [hyperlink,000003AC00000298]Colony Production[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Colonies can increase their production income by building production [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in their [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] and assigning [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] to production [hyperlink,000003AC000002B6]Colonist Slots[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Production can be instantly completed by spending [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink], using the [hyperlink,000003AC0000029D]Hurry Production[/hyperlink] button. Production can also be converted (at a loss) by using [hyperlink,000003AC0000029E]Generate Energy[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000002A9]Generate Research[/hyperlink].

When a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structure[/hyperlink] is selected to be built in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink], it is added to the production queue. Multiple production projects can be added to the queue, to a limit of six. When a project is added to the production queue, the [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] cost and any[hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] cost are paid immediately. If the production project is removed from the production queue before it is completed, the energy and cosmite costs are refunded.[br/][br/]If a structure would unlock the ability to build another structure, adding it to the production queue unlocks the other structure immediately, even if it has not been built yet.

Pronouncements are one sided diplomatic actions from you to another player. One of their uses is to increase or decrease the [hyperlink,000003AC00000097]opinion[/hyperlink] of other players thereby steering towards better diplomatic states or provoking war.[br/][br/]The following pronouncements are available:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000E5]Compliments and Insults[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000E7]Denouncements and Warnings[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

To claim a new [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink] for a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink], a province base needs to be built in that sector. A province base can be built by any unit, but only if the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink] is able to accept the sector (see [hyperlink,000003BD000016D8]Colony Expansion[/hyperlink]).[br/][br/]Province bases are defended by a [hyperlink,000003AC0000029A]Colony Militia[/hyperlink]. The visualization of a province base is altered according to the [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink] that has been built in that sector.

Sectors that are attached to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] are called province sectors. A colony can have up to four province sectors in total.[hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexing[/hyperlink] a sector attaches it to a colony. The number of province sectors a colony can annex is determined by how many [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] the colony has. [hyperlink,000003AC000002B9]Uninhabitable[/hyperlink] sectors cannot be annexed.[br/][br/]Province sectors project a [hyperlink,000003A600000329]Claim[/hyperlink] to all adjacent sectors.

Entropy Weapons channel the forces of chaos to break down matter at the base level.[br/]Entropy Weapons use the Entropy [damageentropy/][hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink]. For the ancient Es'Teq, the Entropy damage channel imparts Energy Drain debuffs that reduce damage, whilst providing Essence Charges to the user.[br/][br/]There is no known way to resist this damage type.

Psionic Weapons are the sinister forces from the Void manifested into weapons that can drive any being insane with agony. The Psionic Weapons Group uses the Psionic [DamagePsyche/] [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink]. The Psionic damage channel ignores all armor, making it effective for dispatching heavily armored units that have few shields. Psionic Weapon abilities include Buffs, Debuffs, and Healing effects.[br/][br/]Ethereal and Mechanical units are resistant to Psionic damage.

Quest rewards are obtained by completing quests for [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC factions[/hyperlink]. A player can choose to accept the rewards or sell them for energy. Note that a player will always get [hyperlink,000003AC0000001B]influence[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]favor[/hyperlink] for completing the [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]quest[/hyperlink], regardless of whether they sell the reward or not.[br/][br/]These rewards can either be:[bulletlist][bullet]Varying amounts of [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]economic resources[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000009C]Weapons and equipment[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]NPC faction units[/bullet][/bulletlist]

NPC faction quests are objectives a player can complete to gain [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]favor[/hyperlink] with an NPC faction, as well as a variety of [hyperlink,000003AC00000277]rewards[/hyperlink]. Quests can be requested by moving an army to a NPC faction army or by interacting with a dwelling. Once a quest is requested, the objectives can be reviewed in the quest interface. These objectives include tasks like defeating an army or completing a special production. A quest can only be requested once every 5 turns for each faction. If no quest has been requested for some time, the faction will send a request automatically.[br/][br]Completing Quests for a NPC Faction will erode your influence with the other Factions. The first time they'll offer a warning but every offense after that will decrease your favor.

{XML_SPECIES_AMAZONS@RACE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Amazons originate from the Terratech BioTech & Terraforming Company that prepared newly conquered planets for habitation by the Star Union. After the fall of the Unions, a Terratech expedition was trapped on a remote world.[br/]What befell the men of the expedition is a tightly kept secret, but the Amazon now rely on biotechnological methods to procreate. This ability to manipulate life extends through all aspects of Amazon culture, they see each world as a canvas, ready to be painted into a paradise.

{XML_SPECIES_ASSEMBLY@RACE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: During the Collapse a colony of test subjects rebelled against their scientist masters, leaving their world devastated and the people sick and infertile. From the wastelands, a hybrid race emerged patched together using cloning, prosthetics and scrap metal.[br/]The Assembly thrive on conflict, with frequent civil wars leading to widespread destruction. The assembly see this as a good thing though, the victors prove their superiority and rebuild their defeated foes in their own image.

{XML_SPECIES_DVAR@RACE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Dvar originate from the mining consortiums sent out to strip worlds of their natural resources. Dvar pride themselves as being the hardiest of survivors, after the collapse the Dvar’ were marooned on a barely habitable planet with an elliptical orbit, causing it to be scorched during short blazing summers and then frozen by eternal winters. To make matters worse, their world passes through an asteroid belt, causing a yearly bombardment of giant rocks. This environment has caused the Dvars to evolve into a bunker dwelling species who see nature as something that needs to be distrusted and looted as soon as a window of opportunity arises.

{XML_SPECIES_KIRKO@RACE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Kir'Ko were the only reported sentient xeno lifeform discovered by the Star Union. The psionic abilities of this insectoid species were seen as a threat, which lead to the Kir’Ko hive queens being lobotomized and their race enslaved. Broken free from their shackles, the Kir'Ko are ready to shape their own destiny.

Commanders have relations with each of the main [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]races[/hyperlink], including their own. Race relations lead to both economical and diplomatic effects:[bulletlist][bullet]Colonies of that race gain/lose [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]happiness[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Units of that race gain/lose [hyperlink,000003AC000000C3]morale[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039A000010D7]Settlements[/hyperlink] of that race require less/more influence[/bullet][bullet]Race Relations modify the [hyperlink,000003AC00000097]opinion[/hyperlink] of other players of that race.[/bullet][bullet]Bad Race Relations cause other players of that race to gain [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli.[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

{XML_SPECIES_SYNDICATE@RACE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Syndicate is a reformation of the trading enterprises that spearheaded the discovery and exploitation of the universe in the early days of the Star Union. The Houses controlled entire star clusters, commanded private armies, and monopolized trade of exotic resources, including Kir’Ko slaves. The Houses developed their own feudal societies and waged bloody wars among themselves.[br/][br/]After power became consolidated in the era of the Imperial Star Union, Territories held by the Houses had to submit to Union control, or face annihilation. Some submitted and were rewarded with hereditary positions, while others didn’t and fled to the Outworlds. The Houses continued to practise their business in secret, until the Fall of Star Union created a new opportunity for the survivors. They formed a new collective, called the Syndicate ensuring they would never again lose their freedom to do business their way.

{XML_SPECIES_HUMANS@RACE@DESCRIPTION}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Vanguard Expeditionary Forces were sent out to claim new worlds beyond the Frontier of the Star Union and its Nexus hyperspace network. When one such expedition arrived at their destination and built the Nexus Portal, they discovered a galactic cataclysm had taken place during their long journey in cryosleep. Now the Vanguard need all their combat and survival skills to prepare for the showdown with the forces that brought down the Union.

After the collapse of the Star Union, the population split into distinct races, each evolving in their own unique way. At the start of the game, you choose one of these main races to embark on a mission to capture one of the former Star Union planets. Each race has their own unique appearance and characteristics. Your race, together with your secret tech, determines what Technologies and Weapon Groups are available to you.[br/][br/]Playable Races and their Weapon Groups:[br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000016]Amazon[/hyperlink] - Laser and Biochemical[br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000018]Assembly[/hyperlink] - Arc and Kinetic[br/][hyperlink,0000039E0000001A]Dvar[/hyperlink] - Kinetic and Explosive[br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000017]Kir'Ko[/hyperlink] - Biochemical and Psionic[br/][hyperlink,0000039E00000015]Vanguard[/hyperlink] - Kinetic and Laser[br/][hyperlink,0000039E0000001B]Syndicate[/hyperlink] - Psionic and Arc

Certain [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Races[/hyperlink] have [hyperlink,000003AC000000C6]Passive Abilities[/hyperlink] that grant all racial units a special property.[br/][br/]For example, the Amazon Race all have [hyperlink,0000039600000C16]Forest Affinity[/hyperlink], which grants +200[happiness/] Morale to [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] when they fight in [hyperlink,000003AC000002C2]Forests[/hyperlink].

Each race can unlock unique racial [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structures[/hyperlink] they can build in their colonies. These structures are locked behind [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] and give unique bonuses to the colony that synergize with their race’s playstyle.

Each of the [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Races[/hyperlink] have their own story to tell about their journey of recovery after the cataclysm. This story is represented by their racial tech group found in the military tab of the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CA]Research Tree[/hyperlink], and provides every race with a distinct playstyle. These racial tech groups are the only group that can be obtained during a game as opposed to the others that you can only select before the game starts. You can do this by incorporating [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink] of different races into your empire, by turning [hyperlink,0000039A000010D7]Settlements[/hyperlink] into colonies or by annexing colonies from a player that is playing a different Race.[br/][br/]These tech groups have a varied purpose, as they can unlock the following:[br/][bulletList][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet] New[hyperlink,0000039E00000072]Tactical Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

Most world map structures that can be built can also be razed. This includes: [hyperlink,000003BD000016D6]Province Base[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC000000C2]Forward Base[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink]. Razing will demolish the location, destroying all colony upgrade [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink]in the base or colony and removing ownership. The ‘Raze’ action is available for all valid locations at all times, and can be found in the sector information panel.[br/][br/]A player can chose to raze their own locations, either via the sector information panel or the colony center tab in the colony interface.[br/][br/]Razing takes 3 turns, and will incur severe [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]Reputation[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000286]Race Relation[/hyperlink] penalties when done to a colony. When this action is started, it can be aborted at any time prior to completion.

Regeneration is a measure of a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit’s[/hyperlink] ability to recover its [hyperlink,000003AC0000030E]Hit Points[/hyperlink] while on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. This recovery happens at the start of the unit’s turn. The amount that a unit regenerates per turn can be found on the unit panel by hovering over the unit’s current Hit Points.[br/][br/]This regeneration can be increased by certain [hyperlink,000003AC000000C6]Passive Abilities[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000268]Economy Research[/hyperlink].

Friendship is the second-highest [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]relation state[/hyperlink] you can achieve with an NPC Faction. To reach Friendship, you need to collect 40 [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]NPC favor[/hyperlink] with the faction. In the Friendship state, you receive a large [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]reputation[/hyperlink] bonus.[br/][br/]The following [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling Trades[/hyperlink] are unlocked at Friendship:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] 2 and Tier 3 NPC Faction units[/bullet][bullet]Stronger NPC Faction [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]The NPC Faction [hyperlink,000003890000060F]doctrine[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Declaring war while in the Friendship state will result in a large reputation penalty.

Integration is the highest [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]relation state[/hyperlink] you can achieve with an NPC faction. To reach Integration, you need to collect 80 total [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]NPC favor[/hyperlink] while in Friendship with the faction. In this state, you receive a very large [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]reputation[/hyperlink] bonus.[br/][br/]The following [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling Trades[/hyperlink] are unlocked at Integration:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] 4 NPC Faction units[/bullet][bullet]The strongest NPC Faction [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000285]Ownership of the Dwelling[/hyperlink], if it can be annexed[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]In addition, the faction allows the integrated player to build in their [hyperlink,000003A600000329]claimed sectors[/hyperlink]. Declaring war while in Integration will result in a very large reputation penalty.

Neutral is the [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]relation state[/hyperlink] you reach with an [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC faction[/hyperlink] after having a positive first meeting with them. It signifies friendly intentions and is the first step towards better relations. On the other hand, any negative actions towards the faction could still result in [hyperlink,000003AC00000284]war[/hyperlink] if not enough favor is collected.[br/][br/]When in the Neutral state, the NPC faction will start to send [hyperlink,000003AC00000276]demands[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]quests[/hyperlink] to maintain and improve NPC relations.

Peace is the [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]relation state[/hyperlink] you achieve with an NPC Faction after just becoming friendly with them. To reach Peace, you need to collect 20 [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]NPC favor[/hyperlink] with the faction. While in the Peace state, you receive a [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]reputation[/hyperlink] bonus.[br/][br/]The following [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling Trades[/hyperlink] are unlocked at Peace:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] 1 and Tier 2 NPC Faction units[/bullet][bullet]NPC Faction [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

War is a [hyperlink,000003AC0000027F]relation state[/hyperlink] with an NPC faction that allows hostile actions from both sides. You can declare war on an NPC faction at any time by interacting with one of their [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwellings[/hyperlink] or by attacking one of their armies. In the war state, all [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling Trades[/hyperlink] are disabled and faction [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]quests[/hyperlink] can no longer be requested or completed. The [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]favor[/hyperlink] is set to -1000.[br/][br/]While at war, the NPC faction will send hostile [hyperlink,000003AC00000288]Attack Squads[/hyperlink] to raid the player’s domain and armies overtime. Attacking an NPC faction that has at least a Friendship relation state with another player, will give that player a [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] against the hostile player.[br/][br/]The only way for a player to actively end the war is by making a Peace Deal through a Dwelling. If the [hyperlink,000003AC00000308]peace deal[/hyperlink] is accepted, the relation state will go back to Neutral and favor will reset to 0.[br/][br/]Being at war with an NPC faction triggers their Faction War Quest, rewarding you for every 10 units slain of the faction you are at war with.

Relation states represent the relations between you and an [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Faction[/hyperlink]. The relation state can increase through gaining NPC [hyperlink,000003AC0000033A]favor[/hyperlink] by doing [hyperlink,000003AC000000D9]quests[/hyperlink], which gives certain benefits, such as unlocking [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling Trades[/hyperlink]. [br/][br/]The following Relation States are available:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000280]Integration[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000281]Friendship[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000282]Peace[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000283]Neutral[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000284]War[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

A [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink] can be released from a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] to become a [hyperlink,000003AC000000C2]Forward Base[/hyperlink] sector using the ‘Release Sector as Forward Base’ action. This action is always available in a province sector, and is found in its the sector information panel. Releasing a sector as a forward base can be useful to maintain the owner’s Claim on the territory, but free up some of the sector limit of the colony to [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annex[/hyperlink] a more valuable sector.[br/][br/]The action will be blocked and appear greyed out if releasing the province sector as a forward base causes another province sector that belongs to the same colony to be disconnected from that colony (provinces must always be adjacent to another province belonging to the same colony).[br/][br/]Releasing a sector as a forward base takes 1 turn, and has a base cost of 50 Energy [energy/] and 10 [influence/] Influence. This action can be aborted at any time prior to completion.

The ‘Move Harbor’ action will transfer the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink]’s [hyperlink,000003BD000016D7]Harbor[/hyperlink] from one of its water-based [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] to another. This action, found in the sector information panel of water-based province sectors, is available whenever the player has two water province sectors attached to the same [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The colony’s harbor will always be located in the first water-based province sector attached to that colony; the second water-based province sector will have the ‘Move Harbor’ action available to it.[br/][br/]Relocating a Harbor is instantaneous.

Reputation represents the way you are perceived by the world. It reflects your actions, good and bad, as you build a new civilization from the Ruins of the Star Union. Reputation influences the [hyperlink,000003AC00000097]opinion[/hyperlink] of other players and the costs of [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]Dwelling shops[/hyperlink]. Players with a negative reputation grant other players a [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] on them. [br/][br/]Reputation is divided into 7 levels; each is dependent on the reputation value: [bulletlist][bullet]Virtuous: higher than 600[/bullet][bullet]Honorable: 400 to 599[/bullet][bullet]Trustworthy: 200 to 399[/bullet][bullet]Neutral: -199 to 199[/bullet][bullet]Untrustworthy: -399 to -200[/bullet][bullet]Dishonorable: -599 to -400[/bullet][bullet]Deplorable: lower than -600[/bullet][/bulletlist]

Research will provide you with new [hyperlink,000003AC00000323]Techs[/hyperlink] from the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CA]Research Tree[/hyperlink] which provide you with all sorts of different capabilities and bonuses that will assist you both in economic development and in war. Your research speed is dependent on the amount of [hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink] you accumulate each turn. Research can provide the player with:[br/][bulletList][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New Operations[/bullet][bullet]And [hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

The Research Tree is where you can set the [hyperlink,000003AC00000323]Techs[/hyperlink] you want to [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink]. The tech tree is split into two segments: the [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research Tree[/hyperlink] and the [hyperlink,000003AC00000263]Society Research Tree[/hyperlink]. Both of these trees have techs that originate from your [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Race[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000329]Secret Technology[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The tree is divided into tiers, with higher tiers of research unlocking higher level content. To advance through the tiers of the research tree, you will have to start with researching lower tier techs. Every higher tier tech requires another lower tier tech before it can be researched.[br/][br/]All of the knowledge you acquire globally is added to the selected research in both the military and the society tech trees at the same time, meaning that there is no trade off between the two.

A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] with a resistance to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink] takes reduced damage from that type. The higher the resistance, the lower the damage will be, as seen in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000292]Damage[/hyperlink] calculation. It will also make it harder for [hyperlink,000003AC000000CB]Status Effects[/hyperlink] of that channel to apply their effects.[br/][br/]A unit with weakness to a damage channel takes increased damage from that type. The higher the weakness, the higher the damage will be. Status effects using that channel will also have a higher chance to apply their effects.

Resource nodes are [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] that generate a steady income of one particular [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resource[/hyperlink]. To collect this income, the node must be in a [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink]. Note that it does not require [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] to be assigned to the resource.[br/][br/]A resource node with a hostile or neutral army on it is considered [hyperlink,000003AC000002EF]Occupied[/hyperlink], and will not yield any economic benefit to the player that owns it.[br/][br/]When a resource node is located in a [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink] of the same resource, it yields a synergy bonus.

Resources are all of the assets and raw materials a you can use to build your empire and improve your military. There are 5 economic resources, used for building up your empire and military, and 3 strategic resources, used for interaction with the Strategic Map and for priming and launching Operations.[br/][br/]The main resources are:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000022]Food[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Strategic resources include:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000002B]Strategic Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Tactical Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000001B]Influence[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]
Added missing white space. "yourempire" is now "your empire". Assume this is an English only fix.

[hyperlink,000003AC000002BE]Unhappiness Events[/hyperlink] and hostile [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink] can cause colonists to become rioters. Rioters still cost upkeep, but no longer produce any income from the resource slot they occupy, and they cannot be moved from that slot.[br/][br/]Continued negative happiness income will increase the number of rioters. Riots can be dealt with by increasing [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]Happiness[/hyperlink] income back to a positive value. For every 20 accumulated happiness, one rioter will turn back into a regular colonist. Another option for dealing with rioters is imposing [hyperlink,000003AC000002AB]Martial Law[/hyperlink]. This will also remove rioters over time, but will inflict economic penalties on the colony.

Roads can be found throughout the world originating from certain [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink]. They are automatically placed between [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Centers[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003BD000016D6]Province Bases[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000C2]Forward Bases[/hyperlink] that the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] builds.[br/][br/]Roads have the lowest [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink] cost of any [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink].

[hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink]-owned [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003BD000016D5]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] have a scanning range within which they can locate [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink]. The scanning range extends beyond their vision range, and will show scanning results on [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hexes[/hyperlink] that are [hyperlink,000003AC000002FF]Unexplored[/hyperlink] or covered in [hyperlink,000003AC000002FE]Fog of War[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]There are two kinds of scanning results:[br/][bulletlist][bullet]Yellow scanning results indicate static armies, which do not move on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[/bullet][br/][bullet]Red scanning results indicate dynamic armies, which move around on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Scanning can be upgraded through [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] to show more information, such as which player or [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]Faction[/hyperlink] the armies belong to.

A [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player’s[/hyperlink] score is a numerical value representing how well they have been doing during a game. At the end of each turn, points are added to the player’s score based on their [hyperlink,000003AC000002B0]Capability Ranking[/hyperlink]. Both capability and score are shown in the ‘Victories and Quests’ interface. The higher a player is ranked in each capability, the more points they earn that turn.[br/][br/]A player’s score is used at the end of the game to determine their [hyperlink,000003BD000016EA]Player Ranking[/hyperlink], but otherwise has no impact on gameplay unless the [hyperlink,000003AC00000343]Score Victory[/hyperlink] is turned on in map settings. The score victory will rank players on their score after a set number of turns, and the player with the highest score will be [hyperlink,000003AC000000B5]Victorious[/hyperlink].

The score victory is achieved when a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] has the highest [hyperlink,000003AC0000026B]Score[/hyperlink] at the end of a set number of [hyperlink,000003AC00000304]Rounds[/hyperlink]. The number of rounds required can be set in map options prior to starting a game.[br/][br/]All players will receive [hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Events[/hyperlink] to let them know how many turns are left in the game so that they know how much time they have to work with to get the highest score possible.[br/][br/]The score victory is closely tied to a player’s [hyperlink,000003AC000002B0]Capability Ranking[/hyperlink].

{XML_CELESTIAN_TECHGROUPS@CELESTIAN@DESC}[br/][br/]{XML_CELESTIAN_TECHGROUPS@CELESTIAN@FEATURES}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Celestian Order was founded a long time ago when Psionic abilities first started to awaken in the human race. They believed this was a new stage in evolution, and advocated a path of inner peace and enlightenment.
The text inserts are the CELESTIAN_TECHGROUPS@CELESTIAN@DESC and CELESTIAN_TECHGROUPS@CELESTIAN@FEATURES texts with some white space, from Cestian_TechGroups_Quotes.xml

Secret tech groups consist of [hyperlink,000003AC00000323]Techs[/hyperlink] that were considered forbidden and off-limits for open use during the days of the empire. After the fall, many of these experimental technologies resurfaced, uncovered by those looking to restore them.[br/][br/]At the start of the game, players do not know which [hyperlink,000003AC00000329]Secret Technology[/hyperlink] any other player has chosen, meaning that you will over time find out what your enemies are capable of as the game unfolds.[br/][br/]Secret techs provide you with specific unlocks that are only available to players with that secret tech. These unlocks include:[br/][bulletList][bullet]Secret tech [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Secret tech specific [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Secret tech [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF8]Doomsday[/hyperlink] weapons[/bullet][/bulletList]

{XML_PROMETHEAN_TECHGROUPS@PROMETHEAN@DESC}[br/][br/]{XML_PROMETHEAN_TECHGROUPS@PROMETHEAN@FEATURES}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Star Union deployed the Promethean Division to cleanse worlds of empire-destabilizing threats. Its PyrX gas was originally developed to immolate areas infested with Xenoplague, but it was rumored the tech was also used to quieten dissenting worlds. Once a planet had been cleansed, the Prometheans would send engineers and colonists to rapidly recolonize the ruins. The Promethean emblem instilled terror in all who saw it.
The text inserts are the PROMETHEAN_TECHGROUPS@PROMETHEAN@DESC and PROMETHEAN_TECHGROUPS@PROMETHEAN@FEATURES texts with some white space, from Promethean_TechGroups_Quotes.xml

{XML_PSYNUMBRA_TECHGROUPS@PSYNUMBRA@DESC}[br/][br/]{XML_PSYNUMBRA_TECHGROUPS@PSYNUMBRA@FEATURES}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: The Psynumbra was a counter-psionics project tasked with stemming the rise of psychics among the population and fighting Outlander psi-agents. Invoking negative emotions allowed them to suppress and dominate their subjects. The project was shut down when Psynumbra leaders began using psionic powers for their own dark agendas, drawing on powers from beyond the void.
The text inserts are the PSYNUMBRA_TECHGROUPS@PSYNUMBRA@DESC and PSYNUMBRA_TECHGROUPS@PSYNUMBRA@FEATURES texts with some white space, from Psynumbra_TechGroupQuotes.xml

{XML_ARTIFICIAL_TECHGROUPS@ARTIFICIAL@DESC}[br/][br/]{XML_ARTIFICIAL_TECHGROUPS@ARTIFICIAL@FEATURES}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: Synthesis was developed by the Omega group, a dark subculture of hacktivists within the Spacer faction of the Star Union. The group rebelled against CORE’s oppression by hacking into the NexusNet and turning its systems against CORE and the Star Union. They developed technology to manipulate the AI’s within NexusNet, going as far as transferring their own consciousnesses into the network, merging with the AI.
The text inserts are the PSYNUMBRA_TECHGROUPS@PSYNUMBRA@DESC and PSYNUMBRA_TECHGROUPS@PSYNUMBRA@FEATURES texts with some white space, from Psynumbra_TechGroups_Quotes.xml

{XML_VOIDTECH_TECHGROUPS@VOIDTECH@DESC}[br/][br/]{XML_VOIDTECH_TECHGROUPS@VOIDTECH@FEATURES}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: Voidtech was developed by a covert division of the Star Union's main science institute. It was created in order to find new applications for Void Travel hyperspace technology. Dimensional Manipulation was used to successfully transmit matter and energy, leading to the construction of cataclysmically powerful weapons.
Text insert are the ARTIFICIAL_TECHGROUPS@ARTIFICIAL@DESC and ARTIFICIAL_TECHGROUPS@ARTIFICIAL@FEATURES texts with some white space, from Artificial_TechGroups_Quotes.xml

{XML_XENOPLAGUE_TECHGROUPS@XENOPLAGUE@DESC}[br/][br/]{XML_XENOPLAGUE_TECHGROUPS@XENOPLAGUE@FEATURES}[br/][br/]ORIGIN: Centuries ago, an expedition discovered an alien creature that came to be known as the Alpha Strain. It was a parasite capable of incorporating the DNA of its host into its own body, collecting traits from thousands of species over its lifetime. The Star Union used it both to improve the physiology of their elite soldiers and to infect enemies with horrifying mutations.[br/][br/]The bio weapon they designed was highly aggressive. The parasite injected cells into hosts that consumed the biomatter around them using a corrosive bile. This process resulted in an exponentially-growing force of nightmarish monsters named the Xenoplague. After Xenoplague outbreaks turned some planets into throbbing bio-hells, further development was forbidden.
Text inserts are the XENOPLAGUE_TECHGROUPS@XENOPLAGUE@DESC and XENOPLAGUE_TECHGROUPS@XENOPLAGUE@FEATURES texts with some white space, from Xenoplague_TechGroups_Quotes.cml

Secret Techs are technologies that focus on developing your empire in a specific way, flavored by some of the fallen empire’s experimental and forbidden technologies. All of these forgotten technologies are remnants of the past, and can guide you into tailoring your play style even further.[br/][br/]

Unowned Sectors adjacent to owned [hyperlink,000003AC000002E4]domain[/hyperlink] are automatically claimed by that player or NPC faction. A claim on a sector means an intent of expanding there. There can be multiple claims on a single sector. Ignoring a claim by trying to settle in a claimed sector has consequences.[br/][br/]Whenever a claim by a player is ignored, they receive [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] points against the invading player. In addition, their opinion towards the invading player is lowered. Players can form a [hyperlink,000003AC00000331]Good Neighbors pact[/hyperlink] to avoid getting these penalties.[br/][br/]If a claim by an NPC faction is ignored, they will send [hyperlink,000003AC00000276]demands[/hyperlink] to the invading player as compensation. Players in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000280]Integration[/hyperlink] relation state with the NPC faction can safely settle in their claimed sectors.

Sector Effects are sector-wide effects that affect your [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]armies[/hyperlink], battles or economy in that [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]sector[/hyperlink]. These are often caused by [hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink] launched on the sector or specific [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]locations[/hyperlink] within the sector. If caused by a strategic operation, the sector effects are often positive for the launcher of the operation and negative for enemies entering the affected sector. The same applies when a sector-effect-applying location is owned by a player. Some sector effects, like the ones from [hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink], are always negative for every player.

After a [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink] has been [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] as a [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink], it can be exploited for economic gains by building a sector exploitation in that sector via the ‘Sector Production Tab’ in the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink] interface. [br/][br/]Building a sector exploitation provides a strong economic boost to the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink]. The higher the province sector’s [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Level[/hyperlink] is, the stronger the economic bonuses from the sector exploitation.[br/][br/]When building a sector exploitation, it is important to match it with the [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain[/hyperlink] features of the [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink], as there are [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] upgrades which provide [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structures[/hyperlink] that can boost the sector level significantly as the game progresses, booming your economy. [br/][br/]Sectors containing a [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmark[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwelling[/hyperlink] have a pre-set, maximum level sector exploitation.[br/][br/]A province sector can only contain one sector exploitation:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003B5000006FA]Energy Exploitation[/hyperlink][/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003B50000080C]Food Exploitation[/hyperlink][/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003B5000007A7]Production Exploitation[/hyperlink][/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003B5000007C2]Research Exploitation[/hyperlink][/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003B500000991]Water Exploitation[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]A sector exploitation can be [hyperlink,000003AC000002A7]Specialized[/hyperlink] by making a mutually-exclusive production choice in the colony center sector production tab, providing unique bonuses.[br/][br/]It is advisable for a starting colony to have multiple different exploitations to remain less specialized, whereas in the mid- to late-game, a larger empire can benefit more from having colonies that are more focused on a specific resource.

Sectors can have a number of features that set them apart from other sectors. Most notable are [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain[/hyperlink] features that determine which types of [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink] will work best in that sector. Note that each clime and terrain must be separately [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researched[/hyperlink] before its effects can be applied.[br/][br/]A sector can also contain minor features in addition, such as rivers and [hyperlink,000003AC000002BB]Special Features[/hyperlink]. These minor features can have an effect on the armies within the sector, as well as the local economy.

The sector level increases the output of a [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink] and makes the effects of its [hyperlink,000003AC000002A7]Sector Specialization[/hyperlink] stronger.[br/][br/]The sector level can be increased by building specific economy boosting [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Structures[/hyperlink] in the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink], unlocked through [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink]. These boost structures upgrade the level of all [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] in the colony with a particular feature, such as all [hyperlink,000003AC000002C2]Forest[/hyperlink] sectors or all [hyperlink,000003B5000006FA]Energy Exploitation[/hyperlink] sectors.

A [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink] that is being [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Exploited[/hyperlink] can then be specialized for additional bonuses by building a sector specialization structure. Sector specializations provide unique bonuses to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] that scale with the [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Levels[/hyperlink] of the sector they are in. For example, a sector exploited for production can be specialized to provide bonuses to unit production or structure production.[br/][br/]Sector specializations are unlocked through [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink]. There are four sector specialization options per sector exploitation type; two get unlocked at Tier 2, the others are unlocked at Tier 8 in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000263]Society Research Tree[/hyperlink] tree.[br/][br/]An exploited sector can only contain one sector specialization, and each sector specialization can only be built in a sector with its matching sector exploitation.[br/][br/]Sector specializations are unique to a colony, meaning a colony can never have more then one of the same sector specialization among all its province sectors.
Added a space between Exploited and can, to clean up the text, does not require relocalization.

The planet is divided into sectors, each containing one or more identifying features. Sectors are themed around geography, or a particular landmark of the fallen Star Union. Sectors are very important for the economy of any [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink], as they can be annexed and subsequently exploited to generate [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resources[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The features of a sector affect how it can be exploited:[br/][bulletList][bullet]A single [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime Feature[/hyperlink] determines the overall climate of a sector. Climes are arid, arctic, etc.[/bullet][bullet]A single dominant [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain Feature[/hyperlink], such as mountains, forest etc.[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] such as [hyperlink,0000039E0000007A]Landmarks[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwellings[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039A00000924]Resource Nodes[/hyperlink] that provide flat income, as well as other structures like [hyperlink,0000039A00000925]Visit Sites[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,0000039C00001C1A]Hazards[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039A00000928]Spawners[/hyperlink] that have strategic effects.[/bullet][/bulletList][br/][br/]Sectors can be owned by [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Players[/hyperlink], as well as by [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Factions[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000A3]Marauders[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]When a sector is [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] to a colony, it becomes a [hyperlink,000003BD000016D5]Province Sector[/hyperlink] and adds its income to that colony.[br/][br/]Sectors can also be [hyperlink,000003A600000329]Claimed[/hyperlink] by both Players and Non-Player Factions.[br/][br/]The sector banner is found in the middle of a sector, and clicking on it will open the sector information panel. In this panel, all the information about the sector can be found, as well as any interactions that can be undertaken.

Skirmishers are [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] that specialize in attacking other units during [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink]. They focus on defeating other units with offensive [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] rather than protecting their allies.[br/]A [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] needs to have a [hyperlink,000003B500000815]Military Skirmisher Barracks[/hyperlink] in order to produce these units.[br/][br/]All [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Races[/hyperlink] start with at least one of these units unlocked, and more can be researched via the [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research Tree[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]These units are usually [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier II[/hyperlink].

The Society Research Tree is where you can develop your economy and steer your empire towards a clear development goal in order to rebuild the empire. It is made up of the [hyperlink,000003AC00000267]Doctrine Tech Group[/hyperlink], the [hyperlink,000003AC00000269]Operations Tech Group[/hyperlink], and [hyperlink,000003AC00000268]Economy Research[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Most of the unlocks in the Society Research Tree influence gameplay on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. However, depending on what race and secret tech have been chosen, you might have several unlocks that influence the tactical map as well.[br/][br/]You can unlock the following by researching the Society Research Tree:[br/][bulletList][bullet][hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink] that have an effect on military and economical gameplay aspects[/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink] to further improve Colonies[/bullet][bullet]More [hyperlink,000003AC0000002B]Strategic Operation Points[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Tactical Operation Points[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]And [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink] to strike from the shadows[/bullet][/bulletList]

Spawners are the home bases of the various kinds of [hyperlink,000003AC000000A3]Marauder[/hyperlink] armies that can be found spread over the surface of a planet. These can be wildlife nests swarming with monsters, or pirate hideouts filled with morally ambiguous profiteers. To get rid of the marauder threat in an area, the spawner must be located and destroyed.[br/][br/]Spawners are [hyperlink,000003AC00000338]Dominant Locations[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] that can be found in any [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink]. They are defended by Marauder [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink]. Spawners are automatically [hyperlink,000003AC000002A1]Razed[/hyperlink] when they are explored.[br/][br/]Spawners are always hostile, and will periodically spawn [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] that roam nearby sectors and attack [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] armies. If there are [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] within their roaming radius, those armies may occupy nodes within them, assault and capture the [hyperlink,000003BD000016D6]Province Base[/hyperlink], or even assault and capture the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink].

A [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink] can contain various unique sector features which provide economic benefits when the sector is [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink]. Each of these special features gives a unique bonus to the sector.

Specialists are [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] that have a role during [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] other than dealing direct damage. They are often experts at healing friendly units or applying Status Effects to enemies.[br/]A [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] needs to have a [hyperlink,000003B500000819]Specialist Training Center[/hyperlink] in order to produce these units.[br/][br/]All [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Races[/hyperlink] start with at least one of these units unlocked, and more can be researched via the [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research Tree[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]These units are usually [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier II and Tier III[/hyperlink].

Splitting an [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] requires you to select it and appoint which units to split off by selecting the [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Point[/hyperlink] icons above the unit icons. After that select the [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink] you wish them to move onto and they will split from their army and form a new one on the new at that hex.

During [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] without the stagger resistance or immunity will get staggered when hit by an ability with [abilityred]High Impact[/abilityred], or if it does not have stagger immunity when hit by an ability with [abilityred]Massive Impact[/abilityred]. When a unit is staggered by such an attack, they lose 1 [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Point[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The unit will only lose 1 total action point from any attack, regardless of whether it is a single shot or a repeating attack. Staggering a unit can stop them from using strong [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] that require 3 action points, or even immobilize it completely by staggering it with multiple different attacks.[br/][br/]A unit with resistance to stagger effects can only be staggered by an attack with Massive Impact. A unit with immunity cannot be staggered by any attack.

Requires relocalization up to Massive Impact. Added/replaced text to better explain the impact mechanic. Note that High Impact is a level of impact of an ability, and Massive Impact is an even greater level of impact for an ability.
State of Vision: Fog of War

[hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hexes[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] that have been explored but are not currently in sight range of a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Location[/hyperlink] belonging to the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] or their [hyperlink,000003AC00000034]Allies[/hyperlink] are covered in fog of war. The planet’s surface is still visible through the fog of war, including all [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink] and locations, but unowned [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] are not visible in the fog of war. [hyperlink,000003AC0000031A]Scanning[/hyperlink] can provide information on unit movement and position within the fog of war.

The parts of the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] that have not yet been explored are covered in a thick blanket of dark clouds. When unexplored hexes come into vision range of a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink]’s [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000002E4]Domain[/hyperlink], they will become explored and will remain so for the rest of the game.

[hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hexes[/hyperlink] on the Strategic Map within the vision range of a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink]’s [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,000003AC000002E4]Domain[/hyperlink] are considered visible. Players can only see unowned units on visible hexes.[br/][br/]Some units have [hyperlink,000003AC000000B2]Concealment[/hyperlink], and can remain undetected even when a player has vision on the hex that they occupy.[br/][br/]If a player has an ally with a [hyperlink,000003AC000002F3]Shared Vision Treaty[/hyperlink] active, they will see all visible hexes that their ally can see.

There are three different states of vision a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] can have over a [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hex[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The three vision states are:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002FE]Hexes in Fog of War[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002FF]Unexplored Hexes[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000300]Visible Hexes[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Vision can be shared between players via the [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomatic[/hyperlink] action; [hyperlink,000003AC000002F3]Share Vision[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]In [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] there are no different vision states; everything is always fully visible.

A status effect is a positive or negative temporary unit property given to a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] by an [hyperlink,000003AC000000AA]Active Ability[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC00000322]Hazard[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operation[/hyperlink].[br/]The chance for a negative status effect to be applied to a unit depends on the strength chance of that status effect and the unit’s [hyperlink,000003AC000002F5]Resistance[/hyperlink] to the status effect channel. Both the strength and the resistance are tied to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink], meaning a unit with high Kinetic resistance has a better chance of resisting Kinetic status effects.[br/]A unit’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] also affects this chance (higher tier meaning higher resistance), serving as inherent protection against status effects on all damage channels.

If a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] produces less [hyperlink,000003AC00000022]Food[/hyperlink] than its [hyperlink,000003AC00000305]Colonist Upkeep[/hyperlink] demands, its food income is negative and the colony is starving. Negative food income from the colony will accumulate each turn, and once it reaches -10, a [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonist[/hyperlink] will starve and be removed from the colony. The starvation level is then set to 0 again.[br/][br/]Starvation can be remedied by increasing the food income of the colony, either by building [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink], assigning colonists to food [hyperlink,000003AC000002B6]Colonist Slots[/hyperlink], or by [hyperlink,000003AC000002AA]Food Sharing[/hyperlink] from another colony.

Strategic abilities are [hyperlink,000003AC000000C6]Passive Abilities[/hyperlink] that certain [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] possess, allowing them to interact with a Sector in a special manner. To trigger these abilities, the unit needs to be at the sector’s center.[br/]An example of a unit that can do this is the [hyperlink,0000039C000004E4]Dvar Prospector[/hyperlink], whose Prospect Sector ability allows it to collect a small amount of resources by interacting with an uncolonized sector.

The strategic map shows the current [hyperlink,000003AC0000033F]planet[/hyperlink], ripe for exploration and exploitation in order to prosper and to learn from the remnants of the Star Union. During strategic map gameplay, colonies can be managed, armies can be moved and strategies can be formed to defeat opposing players. [br/][br/]At the start of a game, the strategic map is mostly unexplored and is covered in [hyperlink,000003AC000002FE]Fog of War[/hyperlink]. By [hyperlink,000003AC0000028E]moving armies[/hyperlink], the planet will slowly be explored and change the [hyperlink,000003AC000002FA]states of vision[/hyperlink] over the planet. This is also represented through the minimap, shown on the bottom-right, which shows a clear overview of the explored parts of the planet. Zooming out shows a larger overview.[br/][br/]Important actions part of strategic map gameplay include:[bulletlist][bullet]Managing [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]colonies[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Expanding domain[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Engaging in [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]diplomacy[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Triggering [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]combat[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Exploring [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]locations[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]For other important actions, keep track of the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B9]Event Notifier[/hyperlink], which shows all relevant events that are still available for that [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]turn[/hyperlink].

Strategic Operation Points are used for priming [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink] that are launched on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink]. You can prime them by selecting them in the operations tab. You then need to spend [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] and operation points to launch the operation. If you do not have enough points to prime an operation in one turn, the operation will consume points each turn until it has accumulated enough.[br/][br/]Operations that use strategic operation points include:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000073]Strategic Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000099]Covert Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003890000060F]Doctrines[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]And doomsday operations.[/bullet][br/][br/]Unlocking more strategic operation points requires you to invest research in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000269]Operations Tech Group[/hyperlink] to unlock some of the [hyperlink,000003BD000016D4]Empire Upgrades[/hyperlink] that award operation points.

Strategic operations can be used to, for example, weaken enemy [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink] by bombarding them or to boost your [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink], among other things. These operations can only be launched on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Some strategic operations make use of [hyperlink,000003AC00000312]Operational Effectiveness[/hyperlink] but this only applies when they are offensive operations that target an enemy or will affect another player in the targeted sector.[br/][br/]In order to use Strategic Operations they first have to be primed. This costs [hyperlink,000003AC0000002B]Strategic Operation Points[/hyperlink] and energy and after priming the operation can be launched at any target within [hyperlink,000003BD00001315]Operational Coverage[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Some of these operations require more strategic operation points that you have available. In these instances, the operation will use Strategic Operation Points on every following turn until it has accumulated enough to be primed. The types of available Strategic Operations depend on which race and secret tech you picked.[br/][br/]Strategic operations can be used on any valid target where you have [hyperlink,000003AC000002FA]Vision[/hyperlink]. This area is called [hyperlink,000003BD00001315]Operational Coverage[/hyperlink].

If a player feels like victory is an impossibility, they can choose to surrender. When surrendering on the strategic map, the player will suffer complete [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]Defeat[/hyperlink] and the game will end for them.[br/][br/]Surrendering during [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]tactical combat[/hyperlink] will instantly defeat all the surrendering player’s units in that battle and result in that encounter being lost by them.

If a player survived untill the end of a game but was not victorious, they are Survivors instead of suffering [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]Defeat[/hyperlink]. As a survivor, the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026B]score[/hyperlink] at the end is often better than when defeated.

When [hyperlink,000003AC000000C0]initiating combat[/hyperlink] on the strategic map, the armies engage in tactical combat with each other. The environment, or tactical map, that the combat will take place in depends on the hex the combat was initiated on. Terrain, clime and [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]hex[/hyperlink] contents, like a location, all influence the tactical map that will be used. Each type of map has its own layout of [hyperlink,000003AC00000320]obstacles[/hyperlink] which makes the direction from which the armies enter combat very important. [br/][br/]During combat, the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B9]Event Notifier[/hyperlink] can be used to show which units still have actions to use. Every unit has a limited amount of [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]action points[/hyperlink] which they can spend on actions each turn. Apart from the first turn, one [hyperlink,0000039E00000072]tactical operation[/hyperlink] can be fired each turn. The defending army always has the starting turn. Tactical combat is won by defeating all the opposing units. A draw will be declared after 30 turns, or if no damage is dealt for 6 turns. [br/][br/]If a player feels like they can no longer win the battle, they can choose to [hyperlink,000003AC000000CE]surrender[/hyperlink] or the attacking player can try to [hyperlink,000003AC000000BF]flee[/hyperlink].

On your turn, when selecting a [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] during [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], you can see how far it can move by the gradient color overlay. The table below shows how many [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Points[/hyperlink] a unit will have left when it moves to each of these color overlays.[br/][br/]Overlay Color[largetab/][largetab/]Action points left when[br/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]moving onto this hex[line/][br/]Green[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]3[br/]Light Blue[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] 2[br/]Dark Blue[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][tab/]1[br/]Red[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] None[br/][line/][br/][br/]The amount a unit can move in combat is determined by its [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink]. Units that are faster on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] will be faster during combat as well, being able to move further each turn. On the other hand, some units are so slow that they won’t even have a green overlay.

Tactical operation points are only used during combat to cast [hyperlink,0000039E00000072]Tactical Operations[/hyperlink]. Unlocking more tactical operation points requires you to invest research in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000269]Operations Tech Group[/hyperlink] to unlock some of the [hyperlink,000003BD000016D4]Empire Upgrades[/hyperlink] that award these operation points.

Tactical operations can only be used during combat, and will allow you to swing the course of battle to your favor by calling in damaging strikes or off-map reinforcements.[br/][br/]Your tactical operations always take one turn to prime at the start of each combat before you can launch them, and you first need to have enough [hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Tactical Operation Points[/hyperlink], energy and [hyperlink,000003BD00001315]Operational Coverage[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The supply of tactical operations is dependent on which race and secret tech you picked. Your race also adds operations linked to the [hyperlink,000003AC00000265]Weapon Tech Groups[/hyperlink] that come with it.

The task notifier is a useful tool that keeps track of the available actions a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] can take during their turn, including [hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Events[/hyperlink]. It will remind the player about armies that have remaining [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink] currently lacking a [hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink] project, [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] needing to be set, etc.[br/][br/]Selecting a message from the task notifier will center the player’s camera on the relevant location or will open the relevant interface. Dismissing a task will add it to the back of the queue so that the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] can handle it at a later time.[br/][br/]The task notifier is located directly above the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E0]Minimap[/hyperlink], underneath the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B7]Event List[/hyperlink].

The tech tree is organized into themed tech groups that depend on the race and secret tech you chose at the start of the game. All tech groups are tiered from 1 to 10; previous tiers have to be unlocked in order to advance through the tech groups. These dependencies are per tech group.[br/][br/]You’ll have access to the following Tech Groups:[br/][bulletList][bullet]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000264]Racial Tech Groups[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000265]Weapon Tech Groups[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000266]Secret Tech Groups[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000267]Doctrine Tech Group[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000268]Economy Tech Group[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]And the [hyperlink,000003AC00000269]Operations Tech Group[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

A tech is an entry on the Research Tree that consists of one or more unlocks that are all rewarded when the tech is researched.[br/][br/]Techs can provide the player with unlocks such as:[br/][bulletList][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operations[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]New [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet]Global [hyperlink,000003BD000016D4]Empire Upgrades[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

Teleporters are the remnants of a highly advanced Star Union transportation network. They link many important and hard to reach locations on a planet. They allow forces to instantly relocate between strategic positions.[br/][br/]They are [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] found on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink], always placed in pairs. Standing on a teleporter will give the [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] the option to instantly move to its counterpart. Relocating in this way will cost [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink] just like regular movement, depending on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain[/hyperlink] the receiving teleporter is located in.[br/][br/]If a teleporter is located within a [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sector[/hyperlink], only the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] who owns that province sector (as well as any [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Players[/hyperlink] that are allied with them) can travel through that teleporter. However, the teleporter can still act as a destination for any player using its counterpart.[br/][br/]Standing on a teleporter will provide the player with limited vision of the paired teleporter.

A [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink] can contain a terrain feature which is associated with two of the main [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF4]Resources[/hyperlink] and provides it with economic potential that can be unlocked via [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink]. A sector can only have one main terrain feature.[br/][br/]The main terrain types and their associated resources are:[br/][bulletList][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002C0]Fertile Plains[/hyperlink][largetab/]([hyperlink,000003AC00000022]Food[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink])[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002C2]Forest[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,000003AC00000022]Food[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink])[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002C1]Mountainous[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,000003AC0000003F]Production[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink])[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002C3]Ruins[/hyperlink][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]([hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000025]Knowledge[/hyperlink])[/bullet][/bulletList][br/][br/]Different terrain features cost different numbers of [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink] when moves through. Through research, faster movement through terrain can be achieved.[br/][br/]A sector also contains one [hyperlink,000003BD00001313]Clime[/hyperlink], as well as any number of [hyperlink,000003AC000002BB]Special Features[/hyperlink].

Fertile plains is a type of sector [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain Feature[/hyperlink]. [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researching[/hyperlink] the [hyperlink,000003B5000003A7]Fertile Plains Exploitation[/hyperlink] research skill can unlock a special [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structure[/hyperlink] that increases the [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Level[/hyperlink] of all food and research [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] with fertile plains.[br/][br/]Fertile plains has a [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Point[/hyperlink] cost of 6 per hex, which can be reduced through research.

Forest is a type of sector [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain Feature[/hyperlink]. [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researching[/hyperlink] the [hyperlink,000003B5000003A2]Forest Exploitation[/hyperlink] research skill can unlock a special [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structure[/hyperlink] that increases the [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Level[/hyperlink] of all food and production [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] with forests.[br/][br/]Forest has a [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Point[/hyperlink] cost of 8 per hex, which can be reduced through research.[br/][br/]The [hyperlink,0000039E00000016]Amazon[/hyperlink] race has special technologies that allow them to make extensive use of forest sectors.

Mountain is a type of sector [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain Feature[/hyperlink]. [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researching[/hyperlink] the [hyperlink,000003B500000A2F]Mountain Exploitation[/hyperlink] research skill can unlock a special [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structure[/hyperlink]that increases the [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Level[/hyperlink] of all production and energy [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] with mountains.[br/][br/]Mountain has a [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink] cost of 12 per hex, which can be reduced through research.[br/][br/]The [hyperlink,0000039E0000001A]Dvar[/hyperlink] race have special technologies that allow them to terraform mountains.

Ruins are a type of sector [hyperlink,000003AC000000D1]Terrain Feature[/hyperlink]. [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researching[/hyperlink] the [hyperlink,000003B500000A34]Ruins Exploitation[/hyperlink] research skill can unlock a special [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structure[/hyperlink] that increases the [hyperlink,000003AC000002B8]Sector Level[/hyperlink] of all energy and research [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitations[/hyperlink] in [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] with ruins.[br/][br/]Ruins have a [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Point[/hyperlink] cost of 8 per hex, which can be reduced through research.

The ‘Transfer HQ’ action will transfer the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Players[/hyperlink]’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000E3]Headquarters[/hyperlink] from one [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] to another. This action, found in the last tab of the colony interface, the ‘Colony Center’ tab, is available whenever the player has two colonies. Transferring your HQ can be a very sensible decision if the current HQ colony is under threat, since the HQ is vital to your empire and your[hyperlink,000003AC0000009D]Commander[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]A player’s empire HQ will always be located in their starting colony at the start of the game, and the ‘Transfer HQ’ action will be available in all colonies that do not have the HQ structure already. Using the ‘Transfer HQ’ action in a colony moves the HQ to that colony.[br/][br/]Transferring the HQ between colonies takes 4 turns. This action can be aborted at any time prior to completion.

[hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] can be transferred from one [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] to another using the ‘Transfer Sector’ action. [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] do not move over to the other colony. This action becomes available when a province sector is part of one colony and is eligible to become part of another colony. The action appears in the sector information panel of the province sector, with a separate action showing for each colony that the province sector is eligible to be part of.[br/][br/]The action will be blocked and appear greyed out when the province sector is eligible to be transferred to a colony, but that colony cannot accept it as a province sector, such as when the colony has reached its sector limit. For more information about sector limits, see [hyperlink,000003BD000016D8]Colony Expansion[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Transferring a sector between colonies takes 1 turn. This action can be aborted at any time prior to completion.

Through negotiations, you can establish a variety of treaties that further cooperation with other empires. Treaties are not mutual per se, and can be manually withdrawn from or given a fixed turn duration. Treaties are automatically ended when starting a [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]war[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Treaties are divided into two types:[br/]Diplomatic Treaties:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002F1]Opening borders[/hyperlink] to other players[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002F3]Sharing vision[/hyperlink] with other players[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC000002F2]Sharing intelligence[/hyperlink] with other players[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000307]Truce[/hyperlink] with other players in war[/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000331]Good Neighbors pact[/hyperlink] with other players[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Resource Treaties:[bulletlist][bullet]Exchanging [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] per turn[/bullet][/bulletlist]

The Good Neighbors pact is a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaty[/hyperlink] that grants a player the rights to build on sectors that are [hyperlink,000003A600000329]claimed[/hyperlink] by another player without triggering any penalties. This treaty is one-sided and requires at least a [hyperlink,000003AC00000036]Non-Aggression Pact[/hyperlink] or higher. Other players and [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]NPC Factions[/hyperlink] may still have active claims on the sector.

Open Borders is a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaty[/hyperlink] that allows another player to move within the domain of the player without causing [hyperlink,000003AC00000302]trespassing[/hyperlink] conflicts. Open Borders is a one sided treaty, the player who is opening their borders may not freely walk through the domain of the other player unless they also open their borders.[br/][br/]Players can only open their borders towards each other if they share a [hyperlink,000003AC00000036]non-aggression pact[/hyperlink] or better, or are including a non-aggression pact in the treaty’s trade [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation.[/hyperlink]

A Resource Trade is a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaty[/hyperlink] that sets up a one-sided gift of resources per turn to another player. During [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation.[/hyperlink], the player sets a specific amount of either [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink] to give each turn. This treaty is typically set up to help allied players who are lacking resources or when asking for another resource trade treaty in return. This treaty is one-sided and requires at least a [hyperlink,000003AC00000036]Non-Aggression Pact[/hyperlink] or higher.

Shared Intelligence is a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaty[/hyperlink] that grants both players increased [hyperlink,000003AC000000E1]operation strength[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000000E2]operation defense[/hyperlink]. Shared Intelligence is a mutual treaty: both players forge this pact at the same time. Additionally, the players suffer decreased defense against [hyperlink,000003AC00000099]covert operations[/hyperlink] from each other.[br/][br/]Players can only share their intelligence with each other if they have an [hyperlink,000003AC00000034]alliance[/hyperlink] or better, or if they include an alliance in the treaty’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation[/hyperlink].

Shared Vision is a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaty[/hyperlink] that grants [hyperlink,000003AC000002FA]vision[/hyperlink] of all of the player’s units and domain to another player. Shared Vision is a one-sided treaty: the player who is sharing their vision may not see what the other player is seeing if that player does not share their vision as well.[br/][br/]Players can only share their vision with each other if they share a [hyperlink,000003AC00000035]defensive pact[/hyperlink] or better, or if they include a defensive pact in the treaty’s [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation[/hyperlink].

A truce is a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaty[/hyperlink] formed between two players to end a war peacefully. Forming a truce brings the players up to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000037]Neutral Diplomatic State[/hyperlink] with each other. They can then choose to further improve their relationship through [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation[/hyperlink]. [br/][br/]A truce lasts 10 turns. If one of the players decides to declare war to the other player during that time period, they will receive a very high [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]reputation[/hyperlink] penalty.[br/][br/]Players can only form this treaty when at [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]war[/hyperlink].

Moving an army into the [hyperlink,000003AC000002E4]domain[/hyperlink] of another player without having an [hyperlink,000003AC000002F1]Open Borders[/hyperlink] treaty is considered trespassing.
