The owner of the domain receives negative [hyperlink,000003AC00000097]opinion[/hyperlink] and a [hyperlink,000003AC00000031]Casus Belli[/hyperlink] towards the trespassing player for each time they trespass. Additionally, they can attack your units without declaring war on you, however they do have to break an alliance if you're in one.[br/][br/]When an army is within a sector that changed owner last turn, they have one turn to leave the sector to prevent trespassing penalties.

Gameplay is turn-based both [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]strategic map[/hyperlink] and in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]tactical combat[/hyperlink]. This means that a limited number of actions can be performed before moving on to the next turn. This process is then repeated. Certain actions require multiple turns to complete, indicated by the [turn/] icon.[br/][br/]Most relevant actions are suggested through the [hyperlink,000003AC000000B9]Event Notifier[/hyperlink]. “End Turn” will be shown as an event when no more suggested actions can be performed that turn. Ending the turn will not allow any further actions until the player’s next turn, except if they need to handle an incoming attack.[br/][br/]See [hyperlink,000003AC00000304]Turns and Rounds[/hyperlink] for more information.

Turning is an important tool in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink] that allows [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] to turn to face a specific direction, potentially avoiding enemy [hyperlink,000003AC000002DB]Flanking[/hyperlink] .[br/]You can turn a unit by selecting it and then holding and dragging in the direction you want to turn it.[br/][br/]This has no [hyperlink,000003AC0000028D]Action Point[/hyperlink] cost, but the unit cannot turn if it has no more action points, such as after using an [hyperlink,000003AC000000AA]Active Ability[/hyperlink] or moving its full distance.

A round encompasses each player’s [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]turn[/hyperlink] as well as the [hyperlink,000003AC0000031B]Independent’s[/hyperlink] turn. Once all of these turns are finished, a new round starts. In classic turn play, the turns are sequential so once the last player has ended their turn, the next round starts with the first player. In simultaneous play, the round ends once each player has ended their turn. The round counter always matches the turn counter shown at the start of each turn and at the top right.

Unhappiness events occur in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] when unhappiness reaches its negative threshold. Unhappiness events cause [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] to become [hyperlink,000003AC000002B4]Rioters[/hyperlink] who occupy their assigned [hyperlink,000003AC000002B6]Colonist Slots[/hyperlink] but do not provide any income from that slot.[br/][br/]Unhappiness is generated by negative [hyperlink,000003AC00000026]Happiness[/hyperlink] income in the colony.[br/][br/]The threshold for unhappiness events to occur becomes lower the more [hyperlink,000003AC0000002D]Colonists[/hyperlink] a colony has, meaning that higher population colonies trigger unhappiness events more easily.[br/][br/]# colonists[largetab/][largetab/]Base Threshold (positive / negative)[br/]3[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]30 / -30[br/]10[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]50 / -20[br/]14[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]70 / -10[br/][br/]Also see:[br/][largetab/][hyperlink,000003AC000002BD]Happiness Events[/hyperlink]

The Unifier victory is a diplomatic victory condition that requires the [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] to have a good overall reputation, as well as good diplomatic relations with various factions on the planet.[br/][br/]The unifier victory is achieved when a player successfully takes control of the planet by means of its planet-CORE AI. A planet-CORE AI is linked into all technology on its planet, including that used by the players. If a player can convince the planet-CORE to appoint them as Ruler of the planet, that player gains ultimate control of the planet and all of their opponents.[br/][br/]In order to appease the planet-CORE AI to appoint a player as planetary ruler, that player needs to launch the [hyperlink,0000038400000782]Planetary Unification Protocol[/hyperlink] operation, which requires late-game [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] to unlock and costs a large amount of [hyperlink,000003AC0000001B]Influence[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The operation can only be launched when the player has the highest level of [hyperlink,000003AC0000002F]Reputation[/hyperlink] and the player or their [hyperlink,000003AC00000034]Allies[/hyperlink] have annexed 2 [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]Dwellings[/hyperlink] of [hyperlink,0000039E00000075]Factions[/hyperlink] they are at [hyperlink,000003AC00000036]Peace[/hyperlink] with.[br/][br/]When a player launches the operation, they will become [hyperlink,000003AC000000B5]Victorious[/hyperlink] after a certain number of [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turns[/hyperlink], called their [hyperlink,000003BD000016DC]Probation Period[/hyperlink]. The planet-CORE AI announces to all the players on the map that a probation period has been started by a player through an [hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Event[/hyperlink], and will reveal all dwellings that player and their allies own to all other players on the planet.[br/][br/]The unification victory is canceled if the player and its allies no longer control three dwellings they are at peace with, or the reputation of the player that launched the planetary unification protocols operation becomes negative.[br/][br/]The unifier victory is closely tied to an empire’s [hyperlink,000003AC00000271]Unity Capability[/hyperlink].

When a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] is attempting the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026D]Unifier Victory[/hyperlink] and launches the [hyperlink,0000038400000782]Planetary Unification Protocol[/hyperlink] operation, they will go into a probation period while the planet-CORE AI determines whether or not they are fit to become ruler of the planet.[br/][br/]The probation period lasts for a certain number of turns, depending on a variety of factors. The base duration of the probation period is 30 turns, but is modified as follows when the operation is launched:[br/][br/]Factor[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]Number of turns[br/][bulletlist][bullet]Each Dwelling the player owns[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]-3[/bullet][br/][bullet]Each player who is allied to the player[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]-2[/bullet][br/][bullet]Each faction who is allied to the player[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] -2[/bullet][br/][bullet]Each player who is at war with the player[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+3[/bullet][br/][bullet]Each faction who is at war with the player[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+3[/bullet][br/][bullet]Each other player with Planetary Unification Protocols active[largetab/]+4[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]After the probation period is started, it can still be modified by the player, as well as by their allies and their enemies, see [hyperlink,000003BD000016DD]Unifier Victory - Probation Period Changes[/hyperlink]. When there are 5 turns remaining on the probation period, the planet-CORE AI will go into [hyperlink,000003BD000016DE]Unifier Victory - Final Consideration Mode[/hyperlink].

When a [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player[/hyperlink] is attempting the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026D]Unifier Victory[/hyperlink] and has launched the [hyperlink,0000038400000782]Planetary Unification Protocol[/hyperlink] operation, they will be in their [hyperlink,000003BD000016DC]Probation Period[/hyperlink] while the planet-CORE AI determines whether or not they are fit to become ruler of the planet.[br/][br/]During this time. the planet-CORE AI closely monitors them, and their actions, and the actions of others towards them, are all taken into account and can impact the length of the probation period. The number of [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turns[/hyperlink] of the probation period can be adjusted in the following ways:[br/][br/]Factor[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]Turn Change[line/][br/][bulletlist][bullet]Player or ally loses a dwelling[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+3[/bullet][br/][bullet]Player or ally gains a dwelling[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]-3[/bullet][br/][bullet]War with a faction started[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+3[/bullet][br/][bullet]War with a faction ends[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]-3[/bullet][br/][bullet]War with a player started[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+3[/bullet][br/][bullet]War with a player ends[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]-3[/bullet][br/][bullet]Alliance with a player made[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]-2[/bullet][br/][bullet]Alliance with a player lost[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+2[/bullet][br/][bullet]Allied player also launches Planetary Unification Protocols[largetab/] -4[/bullet][br/][bullet]Non-allied player launches Planetary Unification Protocols[largetab/]+4[/bullet][br/][bullet]The player’s reputation goes down a level[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]+2[/bullet][br/][bullet]The player’s reputation goes up a level[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] -2[/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Modifications to the probation period only count for the player who launched the operation and not for their allies. Therefore, if an ally of theirs starts a [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]War[/hyperlink] with an enemy, no turn change will occur. The only exception to this is when an ally loses or gains a [hyperlink,0000039A00000930]NPC Dwelling[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]When there are 5 turns remaining on the probation period, the planet-CORE will go into a [hyperlink,000003BD000016DE]Final Consideration Mode[/hyperlink].

When a player is attempting the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026D]Unifier Victory[/hyperlink] and has launched the [hyperlink,0000038400000782]Planetary Unification Protocol[/hyperlink] operation, they will be in their [hyperlink,000003BD000016DC]Unifier Victory - Probation Period[/hyperlink]. Once there are only 5 turns remaining on their probation period, the planet-CORE AI will go into final consideration mode.[br/][br/]During the final consideration each player will receive an [hyperlink,000003AC000002E5]Event[/hyperlink] notification each turn that a player is approaching the unifier victory condition and is about to win the game. The remaining turn number can no longer be reduced by [hyperlink,000003BD000016DD]Unifier Victory - Probation Period Changes[/hyperlink], but it can still be increased to bring the planet-CORE out of final consideration mode.

[hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] that are marked as uninhabitable cannot be colonized, nor can they be [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The most common types of uninhabitable sectors are [hyperlink,000003AC00000325]Ocean[/hyperlink] and full mountain sectors.[br/][br/]Sectors that can be colonized are marked as a [hyperlink,000003AC000002D6]Potential Colony Location[/hyperlink]. Certain uninhabitable sectors can be made habitable, such as with the [hyperlink,0000039E0000001A]Dvar[/hyperlink]’s ability to level mountains to create habitable sectors.

Most unit abilities have a range [range/] that determines the reach of an ability from the caster in hexes. Abilities that can target the entire battlefield will be indicated with a 0[range/][br/][br/]Some abilities have a minimum range in addition to a maximum range, this is shown with two values next to the icon.[br/][br/]For ranged attacks, the distance from the target will have an effect on [hyperlink,000003AC0000030C]Accuracy[/hyperlink] [accuracy/] for some weapons.

As [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] participate in and survive battles, they receive [hyperlink,000003AC000000A1]Experience[/hyperlink] which accumulates to grant them ranks. Every unit starts as a Recruit, and every time they rank up, they get a small Hit Point and Accuracy bonus. At the last rank, the unit gets a Prime Passive Ability that enhances that specific unit.[br/][br/]The Hit Point and Accuracy bonus per rank increases based on the unit's tier. The Prime Passive Ability varies from unit to unit.

[hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] mods are upgrades that are equipped on units and [hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink], enhancing their [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] or giving them new ones. These mods can make even the smallest of units relevant through the late game.[br/]Unit mods are unlocked through [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC00000279]NPC Dwelling Trading[/hyperlink]. Once they are unlocked, they are permanently owned and can be equipped on a unit whose abilities and [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF1]Unit Type[/hyperlink] allow the use of the mod. Equipping a mod costs [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink][energy/] and [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink][tricorium/]. The higher the [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] of the unit, the higher the cost of equipping them with a mod.[br/]All mods come with a small bonus to a unit’s [hyperlink,000003AC000002F6]Armor and Shields[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC0000030E]Hit Points[/hyperlink] or attack [hyperlink,000003AC00000292]Damage[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]A unit that is modded is called a [hyperlink,000003AC0000029C]Unit Variant[/hyperlink]. You can make blueprints for variants either by directly modifying an existing unit, or from within the unit production list of a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Note that, if a mod is added to a unit on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink], the unit will need to wait a turn for the new mods to be applied. During this time, the unit’s mods will be disabled and it will deal 25% less damage.

Units in the game are distributed amongst several roles. These help players determine the general function of a unit and which [hyperlink,000003AC000002A4]Unit Unlock Structure[/hyperlink] they need to be built, if any.[br/][br/]Unit Roles:[br/][hyperlink,000003AC0000029B]Core Units[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF6]Colonizers[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,000003AC0000028A]Specialists[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,000003AC0000028B]Skirmishers[/hyperlink][br/][hyperlink,000003AC0000028C]Elites[/hyperlink]

A unit’s tier indicates its general strength, with Tier I being the weakest and Tier IV being the strongest. Higher tier units are more resistant to [hyperlink,000003AC000000CB]Status Effects[/hyperlink] and have higher [hyperlink,000003AC000000D4]Upkeep Cost[/hyperlink]. It is also more expensive to apply [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] to higher tier units.

[hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] have various types that determine which [hyperlink,000003AC000000CB]Status Effects[/hyperlink] they can suffer from, which [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Mods[/hyperlink] they can equip, and what their [hyperlink,000003AC000002F5]Resistances and Weakness[/hyperlink] are.[br/][br/]The following are the major unit types and any special properties they provide to the unit.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Biological:[/xpcol] Simple carbon based lifeforms.The most common unit type.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Cyborg:[/xpcol] Made of both Biological and Mechanical parts. Has inherent resistance to status effects, but can be affected by both Mechanical and Biological effects.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Mechanical[/xpcol]: Unit made of mostly Mechanical parts. Resistant to [damagepsyche/]Psionic Damage, Weak to [damagewave/]Arc Damage.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Mineral:[/xpcol] Silicon-based lifeforms, made of crystals and solidified magma. Resistant to [damagewave/]Arc and [damagethermal/]Thermal Damage, Weak to [damagebio/]Biochemical Damage. Immune to damage over time effects.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Plant:[/xpcol] Sapient plant life. Resistant to [damagewave/]Arc Damage, weak to [damagethermal/]Thermal Damage.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Mindless:[/xpcol] Unit without a working organic mind. Immune to [strengthpsyche/]Psionic Effects and [happiness/]Morale changes.[br/][line/][br/][br/][xpcol]Ethereal:[/xpcol] Lifeforms without a completely physical body. Resistant to [damagephysical/]Kinetic, [damagebio/]Biochemical and [damagewave/]Arc Damage. Immune to non-Psionic Status Effects.[br/][br/]

In order to build advanced units in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink], they must be unlocked by building special [hyperlink,000003AC00000299]Colony Structures[/hyperlink]. This is in addition to the [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Research[/hyperlink] required to unlock them. There are three different unit unlock structures, each of which unlocks a different group of [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink], divided by unit role.[br/][br/]The following structures unlock the ability to build units:[br/][bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003B500000815]Skirmisher Barracks[/hyperlink][/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003B500000819]Specialist Barracks[/hyperlink][/bullet][br/][bullet][hyperlink,000003B50000081C]Elite Barracks[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist]

Each [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] requires an amount of [hyperlink,000003AC00000023]Energy[/hyperlink] to maintain it, and higher [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Tier[/hyperlink] units may also require [hyperlink,0000039F000024D8]Cosmite[/hyperlink]. If a player is unable to pay their units’ upkeep, their units will get a [hyperlink,000003AC000000C3]Morale[/hyperlink] penalty of -800 and will have a chance of [hyperlink,000003AC000002DF]Deserting[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]A unit’s upkeep can be found on its unit panel or on the tooltip in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink], when producing the unit.[br/]The [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Unit Tier[/hyperlink] is the basis for its upkeep. The costs per unit of a specific tier is as follows:[br/][br/]Unit Tier[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]Unit Upkeep Cost[br/][line/][br/]Tier I[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]4[energy/][br/]Tier II[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/] 8[energy/][br/]Tier III[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]12[energy/][br/]Tier IV[largetab/][largetab/][largetab/][largetab/]24[energy/]4[tricorium/][br/][line/][br/][br/]If a player no longer wants to pay a unit’s upkeep, they can always [hyperlink,000003AC000002E3]Disband[/hyperlink] the unit.

A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] variant is a template which is automatically created when you apply a new combination of mods to a unit. These templates can be given names and icons to help you recognize your units in combat. The unit variant can then be produced in a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] or directly applied to another unit of the same type.[br/]When you create a new template, you will also have the option to apply that template to other units en masse.[br/][br/]During [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], unit variants can be distinguished by the icons above their banners.

Units are the forces that make up your [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Armies[/hyperlink]. You use them to explore the planet, interact with locations and fight battles for resources and supremacy. Units can be produced at [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colonies[/hyperlink]. Some units require [hyperlink,000003AC000002A4]Unit Unlock Structures[/hyperlink] in the colony before they can be produced there. You can research new units in the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CA]Research tree[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Units have [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] that dictate their function and utility in battle. You can further customize your units with unit mods. These mods can enhance a unit’s abilities, or even give them new ones.[br/][br/]Each unit also has their own [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Unit Tier[/hyperlink], which serves as an indicator of its average combat capability. Higher tier units have a higher [hyperlink,000003AC000000D4]Unit Upkeep[/hyperlink], making them more expensive to maintain.[br/][br/]Units that participate in battle gain [hyperlink,000003AC000000A1]Experience[/hyperlink], which will increase their [hyperlink,000003AC000000A2]Unit Rank[/hyperlink] over time, granting them minor bonuses.

A [hyperlink,000003AC00000336]Player’s[/hyperlink] unity capability represents their skill with peaceful resolutions with other players and factions. Players are compared to each other regarding these various aspects and are [hyperlink,000003AC000002B0]Ranked[/hyperlink] accordingly. Their ranking can change at any point during a [hyperlink,000003AC0000002E]Turn[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]The unity capability is tied closely with the [hyperlink,000003AC0000026D]Unifier Victory[/hyperlink] condition.[br/][br/]The ability to view capabilities is unlocked through the [hyperlink,000003BD000004BE]Area Surveillance[/hyperlink] research skill.

A vassal is the subject of an [hyperlink,000003AC000002F4]overlord[/hyperlink] in a [hyperlink,000003AC000000EC]vassalage[/hyperlink]. The vassal player is forced to help the overlord reach victory and cannot break out of the vassalage. The vassal must always accept a [hyperlink,000003AC00000310]call to war[/hyperlink] from their overlord. [br/][br/]A vassal can only be released if their overlord [hyperlink,000003AC00000306]declares war[/hyperlink] on them or if their overlord is defeated.

A player is under vassalage when they have declared their loyalty to another player. A vassalage can be achieved within any Diplomatic State, if the player feels confident enough. In a vassalage, one player is the [hyperlink,000003AC000002F4]overlord[/hyperlink] and the other the vassal. [br/][br/] During a vassalage, the players are locked into an alliance with limited diplomatic options:[bulletlist][bullet]Only the overlord can break the [hyperlink,000003AC00000034]alliance[/hyperlink] by declaring war[/bullet][bullet]Players can no longer [hyperlink,000003AC000000E7]denounce[/hyperlink] or warn others about each other[/bullet][bullet]Only the overlord may [hyperlink,000003AC00000310]call the vassal to war[/hyperlink], and the vassal must always accept[/bullet][bullet]The [hyperlink,000003AC00000341]vassal[/hyperlink] cannot break [hyperlink,000003AC000000EA]treaties[/hyperlink] with their overlord[/bullet][/bulletlist]

[hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Hero[/hyperlink] vehicles work like [hyperlink,000003AC0000009C]Weapons[/hyperlink] and are equipped on the primary weapon slot of a hero, often providing two or more [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink].[br/]When a vehicle is equipped, the hero’s [hyperlink,000003AC0000030E]Hit Points[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000002F6]Armor and Shields[/hyperlink] become that of the vehicle. The Hero also gains the requisites and [hyperlink,0000039F00002DF1]Types[/hyperlink] of the vehicle, allowing it to equip [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Mods[/hyperlink] that the hero would otherwise not be able to use.[br/][br/]When a hero with an equipped vehicle is defeated in [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink], the hero survives with 20% of its maximum Hit Points, escaping to a hex adjacent to the destroyed vehicle. The hero then can only rely on their secondary weapon until they equip a new primary weapon, so caution is advised.

Victory is achieved when a [hyperlink,000003AC00000324]victory condition[/hyperlink] has been met by a player. When a player is victorious, the game will end for all players. If players are in an alliance with the victorious player and [hyperlink,000003AC0000033B]allied victory[/hyperlink] is enabled, they also achieve victory. The remaining players will suffer [hyperlink,000003AC00000340]Defeat[/hyperlink], or end as a [hyperlink,000003AC00000342]Survivor[/hyperlink] in the case of a Domination, Score and Unifier Victory.[br/][br/]Once victory is achieved, players are able to review their [hyperlink,000003AC0000026B]score[/hyperlink] and statistics before the game ends.

In order to achieve Victory, players will have to work towards meeting one of the available victory conditions. These vary greatly and are the main driving force behind a player’s strategy. Players can use [hyperlink,000003AC000002B0]Capabilities[/hyperlink] as a guide to determine what victory condition might be the best to go for.[br/]The following victory conditions are present:[bulletlist][bullet][hyperlink,000003A70000000A]Doomsday Victory[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003A70000000B]Domination Victory[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000026D]Unifier Victory[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC0000026E]Conquest Victory[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000343]Score Victory[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletlist][br/][br/]Specific victory conditions can be enabled or disabled when setting up a scenario. Campaigns often have their own quest-driven victory conditions. While on the strategic map, all possible victory conditions can be reviewed in the Quest interface.

Visit sites are [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] that can be found in any [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink]. A visit site gives a buff to units of an [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] that moves onto it. This buff can either be an immediate effect, such as restoring move points, or a lasting effect that lasts until the end of the units’ next [hyperlink,000003AC0000025E]Tactical Combat[/hyperlink]. Once a visit site gives its buff to an army, it needs to recharge before the buff can be given again.[br/][br/]Visit sites also provide a minor economic benefit when the sector they are in is [hyperlink,000003BD000016CE]Annexed[/hyperlink] to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink]. Visit sites cannot be [hyperlink,000003AC000002A1]Razed[/hyperlink].

Exploration sites are [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] on the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] that can be found in any [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sector[/hyperlink]. An Exploration site is a powerful node giving a variety or resource incomes. An Exploration Site is inhabited by powerful guardians however and must be entered and cleared before it can be used. An Exploration Site often gives a bonus to [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Units[/hyperlink] of a particular type built in the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] to which it is [hyperlink,000003BD000016CE]Annexed[/hyperlink]. [br/][br/]Before Exploration Sites can give any benefits to the [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] that has their sector [hyperlink,000003BD000016CE]Annexed[/hyperlink], their guards need to be removed. Clearing out Exploration sites is made even more perilous because only a single [hyperlink,000003AC0000009B]Army[/hyperlink] can enter a structure to defeat the army lurking within. [br/][br/]Exploration sites cannot be [hyperlink,000003AC000002A1]Razed[/hyperlink].

When two players have been at [hyperlink,000003AC00000038]war[/hyperlink] for a long time without attacking each other, the war expires. A player has 15 turns to launch an attack before the war expires. When they do launch an attack, the timer is reset. [br/]When a war expires, the players return to the [hyperlink,000003AC00000037]Neutral[/hyperlink] diplomatic state and their [hyperlink,0000039F000024D9]Popular Support[/hyperlink] is restored appropriately.

Water [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] that have been annexed to a [hyperlink,000003AC00000047]Colony[/hyperlink] act the same as land [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink], except they also can contain a [hyperlink,000003BD000016D7]Harbor[/hyperlink] and have a different type of [hyperlink,000003AC000002A6]Sector Exploitation[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Only one water province sector can have a harbor per colony. The harbor can be moved using the ‘[hyperlink,000003BD000016D3]Relocate Harbor[/hyperlink]’ operation in the [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink].

There are two types of water sectors: [hyperlink,000003AC00000325]Ocean[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC000002CD]Coast[/hyperlink]. Only coast sectors can contain [hyperlink,000003AC000000CD]Locations[/hyperlink] like landmarks and resource nodes. Ocean sectors are [hyperlink,000003AC000002B9]Uninhabitable[/hyperlink], and can only contain [hyperlink,0000039A00000928]Spawners[/hyperlink]. All water sectors can contain [hyperlink,0000039A00000929]Pickups[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Coast sectors can be [hyperlink,000003BD00001316]Annexed[/hyperlink] by a [hyperlink,000003AC000000E0]Colony Center[/hyperlink] as a [hyperlink,000003BD00001314]Province Sectors[/hyperlink] once the [hyperlink,000003BD000011D2]Aquatic Deployment[/hyperlink] skill has been [hyperlink,000003AC000000C9]Researched[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]This research needs to be completed before units with [hyperlink,0000034500000168]Land Movement[/hyperlink] can embark on water [hyperlink,000003AC000000BD]Hexes[/hyperlink]. Units with [hyperlink,0000034500000991]Flying[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,00000357000005F8]Floating[/hyperlink] can always travel across water.

Weapon tech groups focus on influencing combat, providing the player with new [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] and [hyperlink,000003AC0000002C]Tactical Operation Points[/hyperlink] that correspond with the weapon group to which you have access. Weapon tech groups can be found in [hyperlink,000003AC00000262]Military Research[/hyperlink], and each player always has two available that are associated with the [hyperlink,000003AC000000C7]Races[/hyperlink] they are playing.[br/][br/]There are a total of six different weapon tech groups, and they each correspond to one of the different [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channels[/hyperlink] in the game:[br/][bulletList][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000000D]Arc Weapons[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000000E]Biochemical Weapons[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,000003AC00000293]Explosive Weapons[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E0000000F]Firearms Weapons[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000010]Laser Weapons[/hyperlink][/bullet][bullet][hyperlink,0000039E00000011]Psionic Weapons[/hyperlink][/bullet][/bulletList]

[hyperlink,000003AC000000C1]Heroes[/hyperlink] are the only unit type that can equip different weapons. Heroes start with a basic set of weapons, but can replace them later. Different weapons have different [hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] and determine which [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Mods[/hyperlink] can be equipped with them, depending on the weapon.[br/][br/]There are two types of weapons, primary and secondary, each filling a slot on the hero panel.

These archives contain knowledge concerning all aspects of Age of Wonders: Planetfall; its rules, its glorious locations and its diverse inhabitants. It is a guide on how to build a planet-spanning empire and how to lead it to victory.[br/][br/]Bookmarks:[br/]The bookmarks at the top are used to navigate the Archive's main sections. From left to right: The Basics (you're here now), Game Concepts, Tech, Operations, Units, Unit Modules, Unit Abilities, Hero Disciplines, Map Locations and Colony Upgrades.[br/][br/]Search:[br/]When looking for information on a specific unit or feature, you can use the search function, located at the top of the left side panel.[br/][br/]Links:[br/]The Archives can be navigated through the use of the hyperlinks (indicated as blue text). If you are unfamiliar with the Age of Wonders series, we suggest starting with the articles in this "The Basics" section.

Whenever you detect another player using an [hyperlink,0000039E00000071]Operation[/hyperlink] against you, your Alert Level will rise one level. Each level gives {INT_pointsPerLevel}[operationDefense/] [hyperlink,000003AC000000E2]Operation Defense[/hyperlink] against enemy Operations, and expires after {INT_duration}[turn/]. The alert level cannot exceed {INT_maxLevel}.

[hyperlink,000003AC000000A8]Abilities[/hyperlink] often have a Strength chance to apply an additional effect on top of base effects of an ability to the target [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] . Where 1 Strength equals to 10% to succeed (so 4 Strength equals to 40%). Strength checks always have a [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink] associated with them, indicated by the icon: [br/][strengthbio/] Biochemrical [br/][strengthphysical/] Kinetic [br/][strengthpsyche/] Psionic [br/][strengththermal/] Thermal [br/][strengthwave/] Arc [br/][br/]Each unit targeted by an ability with a strength check will roll seperately for the check. Upon success, the target unit suffers the additional effect, upon failure, no additional effect is suffered unless stated otherwise.[br/][br/]Strength chances can be influenced by [hyperlink,000003AC000000D3]Unit Tier[/hyperlink], [hyperlink,000003AC000002F5]Resistances and Weaknesses[/hyperlink] to the Strength check's [hyperlink,000003AC00000290]Damage Channel[/hyperlink] and other sources such as [hyperlink,0000039E00000063]Unit Mods[/hyperlink] or [hyperlink,0000039A00000925]Visit Sites[/hyperlink].[br/][br/]Final Strength chance is calculated through the following formula in percentage:[br/]final Strength chance = (Strength x 10) x 0.9^((Unit Tier - 1) x 2 + Resistance - Weakness)
A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] with fast movement has 40 [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink][hrmovegeneral/] and 4 hexes to sprint.
A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] with normal movement has 32 [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink][hrmovegeneral/] and 3 hexes to sprint.
A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] with normal movement has 24 [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink][hrmovegeneral/] and 2 hexes to sprint.
A [hyperlink,000003AC0000009A]Unit[/hyperlink] with normal movement has 16 [hyperlink,000003AC000000DC]Move Points[/hyperlink][hrmovegeneral/] and 1 hex to sprint.

When playing against AI players you might find that some of them dislike you. At the start of each game certain AI's are given a dislike, this can be regarding your Race, Secret Tech, Perk or Vice, which negatively impacts their [hyperlink,000003AC00000097]opinion[/hyperlink]of you.[br/][br/]Dislikes can be overcome through [hyperlink,000003AC000000E4]negotiation[/hyperlink], however it will take time to proof that you are different.

An Orbital Relay Network is a transport network created by building [hyperlink,000003E1000000A4]Orbital Relay Exploitations[/hyperlink] and Forward Relay Bases. It allows armies to be instantly transported between different relay points, making traversing the [hyperlink,000003AC000000CC]Strategic Map[/hyperlink] significantly faster.[br/][br/]Relay points are [hyperlink,0000039E00000076]Sectors[/hyperlink] which are either exploited as an orbital relay or have a forward relay built on them. Once researched, a [hyperlink,000003BD000016D5]Province Sector[/hyperlink] can be exploited as an orbital relay like any other sector exploitation. A [hyperlink,000003AC000000C2]Forward Base[/hyperlink] can be upgraded into a forward relay for a cost, if the correct [hyperlink,000003AC00000263]Society Research[/hyperlink] is unlocked. [br/][br/]Once multiple relay points are set up, armies on the sector center can instantly be transported to any other relay point in the network. This can be done twice per [turn/]turn. The network can also be expanded through [hyperlink,000003AC00000330]Diplomacy[/hyperlink] by signing [hyperlink,000003AC000003E3]Open Relay Agreements[/hyperlink] with your allies.

The Open Relay Agreement is a treaty that allows one player to make use of the orbital relays and forward relays belonging to another player, effectively connecting the two networks and allowing travel both to and from friendly relays. The Open Relay Agreement is a one-sided treaty; a player making this agreement cannot use the Orbital Relays belonging to the other player unless they also agree to an Open Relay Agreement.[br/][/br]Players can only agree to open up their relay network when they share a defensive pact or better, and must also first agree to an open borders treaty, or are including all of this in the treaty’s trade negotiation.[br/][/br]Should the relation ever decline below a defensive pact, or should the borders be closed, then this treaty will automatically be broken.
